Job DescriptionWells Fargo Wholesale Banking Technology, part of Enterprise Information Technology (EIT), is looking for a Senior Business System Consultant (BSC 5) to work directly with our Wholesale Lending Technology teams and Shared Services Partners on critical initiatives driven from the Enterprise Technology Prioritization organization.Essential Duties and responsibilities will include the following Analysis and evaluation of currently defined vulnerabilities Delivery of ongoing maintenance of a Vulnerability Management Process Generating and maintain centralized communication process that allows for effective communication between customers and service providers Work with offshore teams to execute overnight plans to target the remediation of specific vulnerabilities or other needs derived from their technology portfolio of clients (Technology application owners) Develop a reporting structure that shows progress and performance across the participating teams related to Vulnerability management Develop asset profiling to allow for targeting of groups of assets, allowing for more effective use of resources involved in the Vulnerability Management program Develop and or maintain documentation, departmental technical procedures and user guides Participates in projects in order to assure quality, security and compliance requirements met expectations and desired results for their supported area Lead and or participate in post mortem process that identifies patching failures and improves the Vulnerability Management process in the future Participate in production outages/impacts on EACO and resolution including troubleshooting, documentation and communications Liaison role for application stack aligned and will be active participant in partner meetings both technology and business partnerships Assist and work with Compliance, Audit and Shared Service partnerships to verify systems and/or integration capabilities and completeness with project areas of focus/engagement Ensure designs/plans are keeping the long term health and quality of the applications top priority * Ambassador for application technology teamsRequired Qualifications7+ years of business systems analysis experience, business systems design experience, or a combination of bothDesired QualificationsExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsOther Desired Qualifications SDLC Experience and general understand of Build & Release Tools supporting the application stack Java and .net-tooling experience is a plus 3+ years advanced skills with Microsoft Office products Practical experience in supporting and maintaining Business Continuity Planning (BCP) Knowledge and understanding of full life cycle application development Ability to interact with all levels of an organization Strong relationship management skills Ability to assess issues, make quick decisions, implement solutions, and influence change Demonstrated release and configuration management experience, supporting application and infrastructure Strong problem solving and analytical skills Knowledge and understanding of project management methodologies: used in waterfall or Agile development projectsDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Job Description - Field Specialist General – DRS (1708065)Job Description Field Specialist General – DRS (Job Number: 1708065)   EMPLOYMENT STATUS   Full Time Regular   ABOUT THIS JOB   Field Specialist General – DRS   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIES   Under broad direction provides direct instruction and supervision to junior Field Engineers on day-to-day well site work and activites.Provides advice and direction to external customer and third-partywellsite colleagues as appropriate. Provides resolution to a diverse scope and range of complex problems at the well site where analysis of data requires having a broad knowledge of the product line's tool(s)and/or service(s). Work is evaluated upon completion by a Field Supervisor (where appropriate), local Operations Management and the external Customer to ensure objectives have been met. Acts as a project leader and mentors junior field engineers.  Expected to maintain frequent intra-organizational and external customer contacts with a high degree of professionalism. Executes other related duties as assigned. Conducts all business activities in accordance with Baker Hughes HSEpolicies, Legal Compliance requirements and Baker Hughes Core Values.   ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS Two year Technical Degree preferred. Industry experience and product line training required     PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS    Two year Technical Degree preferred. Industry experience and product line training required.     COMPANY OVERVIEW   Baker Hughes is a leading supplier of oilfield services, products, technology and systems to the worldwide oil and natural gas industry. By being the service company that best anticipates, understands and exceeds our customers' expectations, Baker Hughes Advances Reservoir Performance. The company's 39,000-plus employees work in more than 80 countries in geomarket teams that help customers find, evaluate, drill, produce, transport and process hydrocarbon resources. Baker Hughes' technology centers in the world's leading energy markets are pushing the boundaries to overcome progressively more complex challenges. Baker Hughes develops solutions designed to help manage operating expenses, maximize reserve recovery and boost overall return on investment through the entire life cycle of an oil or gas asset. Collaboration is the foundation upon which Baker Hughes builds our business and develops next-generation products and services for drilling and evaluation, completions and production and fluids and chemicals. For more information on Baker Hughes' century-long history, visit http://www.bakerhughes.com/   Baker Hughes is an Equal Employment Affirmative Action Employer. Job Description - FP&A Manager - Houston, TX (1708108)Job Description FP&A Manager - Houston, TX (Job Number: 1708108)   LOCATION   Houston, TX   EMPLOYMENT STATUS   Full Time Regular    ABOUT THIS JOB   Baker Hughes Incorporated has an opening for a Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) Manager in Houston, TX and will serve as a business partner to the Gulf of Mexico Sales team for revenue planning, forecasting, and bridging market forces for all Product Lines. As a leader in the oilfield services industry, Baker Hughes offers opportunities for qualified people who want to grow in our high performance organization. Our leading technologies and our ability to apply them safely and effectively create value for our customers and our shareholders.     KEY RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIES  Financial Planning and Reporting for 2 product lines across North America South Geomarket Strong Strategic business partner to the district managers, sales team, functional team leads and product line directors. Preparing and Interpreting financial plans, month end financials, and weekly flashes for the various business partners and functional leads Present Plans, month end financials, and weekly flashes to North America South Leadership team Performing monthly operating expense reviews and variance analyses, monitoring and managing capital expenditures, headcount, DSO, and Inventory Provide reporting and analytical support for operational and strategic initiatives to the various business partners Assisting Management with continuously improving the management information provided to Leadership team and others Perform ad-hoc analyses and additional related duties as assigned      ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or equivalent 5+ years of Financial Analysis experience  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS Oil & Gas industry experience preferred Strong SAP, Excel, HFM, Communication skills and CPA a plus. Requires 15% travel     COMPANY OVERVIEW   Baker Hughes is a leading supplier of oilfield services, products, technology and systems to the worldwide oil and natural gas industry. Job Description - Middleware Architect (00022756861)Job Description Middleware Architect(Job Number: 00022756861) Description  Cognizant is a leading provider of Information Technology, Consulting, IT Infrastructure, and Business Process Outsourcing services. Cognizant’s single-minded mission is dedicate our business process and technology innovation know-how, deep industry expertise, and worldwide resources working together with customers make their businesses stronger. As a customer-centric, relationship-driven partner, we are redefining the way companies experience and benefit from global services. Our unique delivery model is infused with a distinct culture of high customer satisfaction. Cognizant delivers a trusted partnership, cost reductions and business results. We are looking for Middleware ArchitectJob DescriptionThis role concentrates on the design of infrastructures including servers, storage, workstations, middleware, non-application software, networks, and the physical facilities that support the applications and business processes required by the client. Included in the focus areas is the critical evaluation and selection of the software and hardware components of the infrastructure. Best practices in this role use various techniques including modeling, simulation, and testing to validate the designs and selected products. Infrastructure Architects are responsible for performance, availability and scalability of the infrastructure.Role & ResponsibilityExperience as an IT Architect and/or Senior IT Consultant.Executed and implemented some medium / large projects.Very good written and verbal communication skills including presentation skills.Ability to work in a customer-facing environment.Needs technical leadership skills and the ability to articulate and compare Alternatives Approaches and how the technical solution will address client’s needs and pain points.Needs negotiating skills and to be astute in the interpersonal and political aspects of a sales situation.Ability to manage and integrate cross-SPL reference architectures, cross-brand solution components and non-IBM solutions.Skill Required:WebSphere Application Server Network Deployment (WAS ND) v6.1.x, v7.x.WebSphere extreme Scale 7.x.Knowledge of WebSphere Service Registry and Repository.IBM HTTP Server (IHS) v6.1.x, v 7.x.AIX/Unix command line.Experience with Standalone, domain mode Jboss and experiencing in building out HA, clustered environment.Experience in JDBC/JMS configuration and code deployment on JBOSS DB2 plan and IMS PSB implementation in test and Dev environments. Coordinate on PROD implementation.ExtraHop. Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process outsourcing services, dedicated helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. JobTitle: Executive - Carve-out/Merger Integration Advisory - IT Focus - Dubai
JobText: Job Description - Executive - Carve-out/Merger Integration Advisory - IT Focus - Dubai (DUB002WD)Job Description Executive - Carve-out/Merger Integration Advisory - IT Focus - Dubai - DUB002WDAE-All-DubaiOur Transaction Advisory Services (TAS) team works with clients to manage their capital agenda to drive competitive advantage and increased returns. As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimizing, raising or investing capital. Major groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines and competencies) within TAS include Mergers and Acquisition Services, Project Finance, Restructuring Services, Operational Transaction Services, Transaction Support, Corporate Finance Strategy,  Transaction Tax, and Valuation and Business Modelling.   Join our Operational Transaction Services team and provide clients a full range of hands-on, operationally focused support and advice across the transaction life cycle, supporting both buyers and sellers. We cover a wide range of operational aspects of a transaction, including carve-out readiness and support, operational due diligence and restructuring, synergy assessment and delivery, day-one readiness assessment and post-merger integration planning and delivery support.   The role:   Apply general principles related to a functional area to provide advice about potential transaction risk and issues Take responsibility for research and applies new developments in simple client situations Apply functional experience and knowledge to appropriately customize the application of OTS methodologies to meet client needs Demonstrate basic knowledge of OTS methodology including tools and templates by preparing initial scope and specific procedures Assess the client’s state of readiness to execute integration plans or preparation for financial, legal and operational separation Assess one-time costs to build or buy support services that are not part of the transaction and the one-time costs to execute the transaction Identify transaction risk and issues and communicate to project leader Regularly report filtered information to colleagues internally and (under direction) facts to clients Develop technical expertise in the specialised competency and be confident in articulating it’s TAS value offering to the market Build and expand networks whilst developing personal brand and shaping high performing teams to deliver exceptional client experience.  Qualifications   To qualify, candidates must have: Experience in management consulting from a recognised consulting firm and/or big 4 Transaction experience and technical skills in relevant areas such as pre-deal transaction support, commercial and operational due diligence, synergy identification and assessment, post - merger integration or carve-out support and benefits realisation client interaction skills Ability to adapt to a constantly changing and growing business environment     Who we are   With so many offerings, you have the opportunity to develop your career through a broad scope of engagements, mentoring and formal learning. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. Sound interesting? Well this is just the beginning. Because whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

JobTitle: Performance Improvement, Manager/ Senior Manager (Master Data Management), Financial Services, Advisory, Singapore
JobText: Job Description - Performance Improvement, Manager/ Senior Manager (Master Data Management), Financial Services, Advisory, Singapore (SIN00346)Job Description Performance Improvement, Manager/ Senior Manager (Master Data Management), Financial Services, Advisory, Singapore - SIN00346SG-All-Singapore We are the only professional services organisation who has a separate business dedicated exclusively to the financial services marketplace. Join Financial Services (FSO) and you will work with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world to deliver a global perspective. Aligned to key industry groups including asset management, banking and capital markets, insurance and private equity, we provide integrated advisory, assurance, tax, and transaction services.   The opportunity    EY’s Performance Improvement Advisory professionals bring a wealth of experience in working with major financial institutions to align their operating model and infrastructure to their business’ strategic objectives. We assemble the right multi-disciplinary teams, use consistent and proven global methodologies and tools, and draw on the full breadth of EY’s global network, to deliver value and trusted advice to the clients. The key service offerings cover finance function transformation, customer and distribution effectiveness, operations, shared services / outsourcing support, performance management, program advisory, enterprise intelligence, risk management and regulatory change.   Your key responsibilities As markets rapidly change and develop, finance functions must demonstrate real added value to their business. As a finance advisor, you’ll use your experience and knowledge to help deliver greater insight – delivering functional efficiencies as well as transforming the role of finance in our clients’ businesses. You’ll be developing innovative, sustainable ways to improve the management of people, processes and systems, working alongside other finance professionals in high-performing teams.   Skills and attributes for success Good understanding of economic or market issues and the ability to interpret their impact on clients Strong analytical, problem-solving and communication skills Leverage technology to continually learn, improve service delivery and maintain our leading edge best practices Strong presentation skills and proficiency in the use of PowerPoint, Word and Excel To qualify for the role you must have Minimum 10 years of financial services experience, with 8 years of data technology experience (Enterprise Master Data Management (MDM) along with Data Modeling, Data Governance, Meta Data Management, Data Architecture) Previous exposure of MDM tool experience (SAS and IBM MDM tool experience is preferred) Experience in Master Data Management (MDM): business process design for managing master data throughout the lifecycle Experience in playing the role of a MDM Architect and leading large MDM Implementation for a full SDLC lifecycle. Architected solution to enable 360 degree customer view and have data quality concept understanding Ideally, you’ll also have Strong people management skills and able to work/ manage multiple client engagements Track record dealing with senior stakeholders and adapting to demanding environments Understanding of Enterprise Data Warehouse What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization   What working at EY offers We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you: Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you   About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

JobTitle: Asia-Pacific People Reporting Lead, Core Business Services - Sydney or Melbourne
JobText: Job Description - Asia-Pacific People Reporting Lead, Core Business Services - Sydney or Melbourne (SYD0032T)Job Description Asia-Pacific People Reporting Lead, Core Business Services - Sydney or Melbourne - SYD0032TArea (Various Locations)About the opportunity   We are looking for an Asia-Pacific People Reporting Manager to work in a new global team established within EY Business Enablement Shared Services that is organized under common leadership and a new operating model. Responsible for HR processes, transactions and technology across our global organization, HR Services mission is to deliver world class processes enabled by globally consistent technology. People Reporting and Analytics is a key sub function that delivers reporting and analytics services to Talent teams globally.   Reporting to the Director, Global People Reporting, the Reporting Manager will be very closely aligned to the global Talent team and the successful candidate will become a key member of the People Reporting leadership team.   About you   This role is the most senior point of contact to resolve ad hoc and complex report issues raised by talent clients in APAC and Talent Development. In conjunction with the Americas and EMEIA reporting peers designs and directs the report build and the Core functions of Recruiting, Learning and HR own management reporting process. In your role as Asia-Pacific People Reporting Manager you will: Works closely with Area and Region Talent clients to understand and deliver reporting requirements and provide advice Produces specific and complex management reporting with people data from EY systems Participates in major EY Talent sponsored projects and directs project reporting requirements and analysis Leads and directs the work of others in the People Reporting team Builds and owns management reporting processes and procedures Builds and maintains collaborative relationships with key stakeholders Provides ideas for continuous improvement and innovation Manages a team of reporting analysts We are looking for people with the following experience: Extensive reporting experience including knowledge of process. Exposure to data analysis, data interpretation and advising senior leaders of results. Significant operational experience with HR processes, recruiting, learning, performance management and people data. Experience creating standard metrics and key performance indicators. Knowledge of HR data privacy laws, information security and quality principles. Strong relationship and communication skills across multiple countries and cultures. Excellent teaming skills required to work in a virtual work environment. A self-starter, self-motivated and able to work with specific but minimal direction. Microsoft Excel, MS SharePoint. Power BI, Oracle SQL, Business Objects and technical knowledge for report production. An overall understanding of people data with process knowledge related to PeopleSoft and/or Taleo (performance or recruiting) is required. Experience in management and operation of large scale reporting including supporting multiple countries, is also necessary. Ability to build strong working relationships across diverse client needs, including senior leadership. Multi-language skills advantageous. SSRS or SharePoint knowledge is also preferred. Training will be provided as the firm transitions to a new reporting platform standard (Microsoft).  Both system and process knowledge is preferred. About what we'll provide   We are proud of our strong people centric culture. You will be respected, encouraged to seek out opportunities and be driven to develop faster.  Not matter when you join, or for however long you stay, you'll gain valuable experiences that will open doors for you, not just now, but throughout your entire professional career.   Interested?   For a role with growth and support apply today and join a firm that is committed to building an inclusive culture that supports a diverse workforce, providing you with the exposure, development and networking opportunities to drive your career forward.     Apply Now The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider.

Job Description - Cyber Security Assistant Manager (SOU0016L)Job Description Cyber Security Assistant Manager - SOU0016LZA-GT-Johannesburg Cyber threats, social media, massive data storage, privacy requirements and continuity of the business as usual require heavy information security measures. As an information security specialist, you will lead the implementation of security solutions for our clients and support the clients in their desire to protect the business. You will belong to an international connected team of specialists helping our clients with their most complex information security needs and contributing toward their business resilience. You will be working with our Advanced Security Centers to access the most sophisticated tools available to fight against cybercrime.   We will support you with career-long training and coaching to develop your skills. As EY is a global leading service provider in this space, you will be working with the best of the best in a collaborative environment. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.  The EY cyber security team is looking for a number of staff members across levels from Assistant Manager to Associate Director. As a Cyber Security Consultant, you will contribute technical insights to client engagements and internal projects. An important part of your role will be to actively establish, maintain and strengthen internal and external relationships. You'll also identify potential business opportunities for EY within existing engagements and the market. The more senior the role, the higher the expectation around winning market opportunities.  Experience: Ideally you will have experience with a globally recognised professional services firm or large corporations with industry experience in a number of the following areas: •           Experience in assessing an implementing security and risk standards including ISO 2700X, NIST, ITIL, COBIT •           Systems security skills in assessment, design, architecture, management and reporting •           Conduct Information Security Assessment against EY Methodology and leading practice frameworks and common standards. •           Conduct attack and penetration on infrastructure, network, web application and source code review. •           Assist client in managing and transforming their Information Security Programs. •           Assist client in managing their Business continuity and disaster recovery. •           Assist clients in designing and implementing their identify and access management solutions •           Assist client in managing their information protection and data privacy. •           Evaluate and analyze threat, vulnerability, impact and risk to security issues discovered from security assessments. •           Advise clients on the IT security issues, including explanation on the technical details and how they can remediate the vulnerabilities in the systems. ·                     Application control and security implementation, program and project delivery design, architecture and solution design, •           Industry related certification required (e.g.CISSP, CISM,  CISA, CIA, CIA)   To qualify all applicants must have: •           At least 4 years of professional experience in either a technical IT Risk or an IT Security role •           Strong project management skills and interpersonal skills •           Advanced written and verbal communication skills and presentation skills, Strong analytical, interpersonal. •           Strong interest in the field of information security •           Creative, independent with good problem solving skills •           Be willing to travel as required •           Client service delivery and able to manage multiple engagement teams and projects •           Experience in coaching and supervising junior team members •           Demonstrated integrity within a professional environment •           Have a drive to build a team and grow your technical information security career to the next level •           You may also have a Bachelor's and/or post graduate degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, or a related major (such as accounting).   The successful candidate must hold or be willing to pursue related professional certifications such as the CISSP, CISM, and/or CISA CA / CIA advantageous

Advise clients on the IT security issues, including explanation on the technical details and how they can remediate the vulnerabilities in the systems. Application control and security implementation, program and project delivery design, architecture and solution design  To qualify all applicants must have: At least 4 years of professional experience in either a technical IT Risk or an IT Security role Industry related certification required (e.g.CISSP, CISM,  CISA, CIA, CIA) Strong project management skills and interpersonal skills Advanced written and verbal communication skills and presentation skills, Strong analytical, interpersonal. Strong interest in the field of information security Creative, independent with good problem solving skills , Be willing to travel as required Client service delivery and able to manage multiple engagement teams and projects Experience in coaching and supervising junior team members Demonstrated integrity within a professional environment Have a drive to build a team and grow your technical information security career to the next level   You may also have a Bachelor's and/or post graduate degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, or a related major (such as accounting).   The successful candidate must hold or be willing to pursue related professional certifications such as the CISSP, CISM, and/or CISA CA / CIA advantageous   Sector specific experience in key sectors such as financial services, oil and gas, mining, retail, telecoms and technology would be considered advantageous   Who we are:   At EY we support you in achieving your unique potential both personally and professionally. We give you stretching and rewarding experiences that keep you motivated, working in an atmosphere of integrity and teaming with some of the world's most successful companies. And while we encourage you to take personal responsibility for your career, we support you in your professional development in every way we can. You enjoy the flexibility to devote time to what matters to you, in your business and personal lives. At EY you can be who you are and express your point of view, energy and enthusiasm, wherever you are in the world. It's how you make a difference.   Please note: Preference will be given to PDI candidates.

JobTitle: Associates, Engagement Auditors and Senior Auditors - Assurance
JobText: Job Description - Associates, Engagement Auditors and Senior Auditors - Assurance (ABU0010U)Job Description Associates, Engagement Auditors and Senior Auditors - Assurance - ABU0010UAE-All-Abu DhabiFrom small businesses to some of the world’s best-known brands, our clients count on reliable financial statements, information and processes to inform their on-going strategies. More than ever, business is about interpreting and reacting to complex data - and they look to us for advice and services they can trust every time. You will use your professional skills and experience to make it happen, handling complex audit procedures across a broad range of industries and responsibilities.   The opportunity   We are currently seeking Associates, Engagement Auditors and Senior Auditors to support our Audit team and help our clients meet their requirements by accurately reporting on financial statements and providing meaningful insights into accounting and reporting matters. In return, you can expect leading-class learning and development tailored to your unique interests and motivations. You will be given all the skills, knowledge and opportunities to progress and become ready to build a better working world for our people, our clients and the communities that support us.   Your key responsibilities   As an External Auditor in EY, you will make a technical contribution to audit client engagements and internal projects. Within your role, you will actively establish, maintain and strengthen internal and external relationships, execute complex assurance procedures, supervise junior engagement team members and help define the audit strategy. Working under the supervision of senior team members, you will help execute our work and present its findings to the client.   Skills and attributes for success   Supporting the planning, execution and delivery of assurance engagements Working effectively as a team member on all audit related fieldwork and updating senior team members on progress Assisting with the preparation of memoranda, working papers, letters and correspondence Drafting financial statements and foot­note disclosures in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles Constantly developing your understanding of current market trends and processes and sharing your knowledge to develop junior colleagues Developing and maintaining productive working relationships with client personnel Building strong internal relationships within Assurance and across other services  To qualify for the role you must have Approximately 1 - 5 years of audit working experience Strong academic record including a Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field Professional accountancy qualification or working towards gaining one (CA , ACCA or CPA qualified Familiarity with IFRS and local GAAP Excellent communication and prioritization skills Strong teamwork and leadership/project management skills Results-oriented approach with keen attention to high quality, details and accuracy Self-motivation and desire to exceed expectations Eligibility to travel in accordance with client and other job requirements both locally and internationally   Ideally you will also have   Track record with a leading audit firm Proficiency in the Arabic language Sector experience in one or more of the following: Construction, Energy, Financial Services,  Government & Public Sector, Healthcare   What we look for We are interested in leaders with a genuine creative vision and the confidence to make it happen. You can expect plenty of autonomy in this role, so you will also need the ability to take initiative and seek out opportunities to improve our current relationships and processes. If you are serious about auditing and ready to take on some of our clients’ most complex issues, this role is for you. What working at EY offers Support, feedback and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career in the MENA region Developed system of performance management and career development that enables you to have the freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you Opportunity to work in an international environment   About EY   As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

JobTitle: Advisory - Performance Improvement - Supply Chain and Operations - Senior
JobText: Job Description - Advisory - Performance Improvement - Supply Chain and Operations - Senior (SHA000VL)Job Description Advisory - Performance Improvement - Supply Chain and Operations - Senior - SHA000VLCN-Shanghai-Shanghai As new markets open up and technology advances at a dramatic pace, the world of supply chain and operations is becoming increasingly complex. At the same time, clients understand just how vital effective, sustainable operational management is to their global success. As a supply chain and operations professional, you’ll use your analytical insight to drive our clients’ global business performance. Working as part of a high-performing team, you’ll deliver exceptional client service and help leading organizations improve their planning, design, procurement, sourcing, manufacturing, fulfillment, operations and services processes.   We’ll support you with formal training to develop the skills and knowledge you need to solve some of the most complex business challenges around. And working as part of a truly integrated global network, you’ll gain unrivaled experience across different geographies and sectors. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   Client responsibilities ·         Participate in business development and sales activities for nominated MNC accounts and build long-term client relationships and networks in these accounts ·         Consistently deliver quality work that clients value  for major programs /projects within the Supply Chain & Operations domain ·         Actively build business networks internally and externally to promote EY & the Advisory brand ·         Build strong internal relationships within Ernst & Young Advisory and with other services across the organization   People responsibilities ·         Foster an innovative and inclusive work environment ·         Maintain and participate in an educational program to continually develop personal skills ·         Understand and follow workplace policies and procedures and communicate these to all levels of staff   Technical skills requirements ·         In-depth knowledge and experience in Supply Chain & Operations, ideally with specialization in one or more of the following: o    Tax efficient supply chain management (TESCM) o    Procurement transformation o    Supply chain planning o    Logistic Management & Network Strategy ·         Proven knowledge and experience in one or more of the following priority industry sectors: Consumer Products Retail Healthcare & life sciences High-Tech Requirements ·         Recognized university Bachelor's or Master's degree with a minimum of 2 years' working experience, preferably with 1+ year in a business consulting role with a leading consultancy organization.  ·         Demonstrate at least one supply chain management core domain knowledge/experience, including but not limited to supply chain management planning, inventory management, manufacturing and procurement; ·         Prior consulting experience in the supply chain advisory field is preferred; ·         Professional accounting or finance qualification is an advantage; ·         Ability to establish personal credibility quickly and demonstrate expertise; ·         Excellent command of written and spoken English; ·         Travel within the Asia Pacific region is required.

As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimizing, raising or investing capital. Major groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines and competencies) within TAS include Mergers and Acquisition Services, Project Finance, Restructuring Services, Operational Transaction Services, Transaction Support, Corporate Finance Strategy, Transaction Tax, and Valuation and Business Modelling.   Join our Operational Transaction Services team and provide clients a full range of hands-on, operationally focused support and advice across the transaction life cycle, supporting both buyers and sellers. We cover a wide range of operational aspects of a transaction, including carve-out readiness and support, operational due diligence and restructuring, synergy assessment and delivery, day-one readiness assessment and post-merger integration planning and delivery support.   The role:   Demonstrate an understanding of specific functional risks and challenges in one or two functional areas Recommend strategies to mitigate transaction planning and execution risk and opportunities to improve operations and extract value Demonstrate an understanding of the interdependencies between functions. Develop presentations or articles that capture lessons learned about specific functions, and shares knowledge across the practice Develop an understanding of the practices and risks related to multiple functional areas Keep abreast of trends and leading practices in a particular functional area to apply in client engagements Challenge the engagement scope and specific procedures and suggest modifications that will address the client’s needs and concerns better Identify issues, understand root cause and advise clients with pragmatic solutions Assess value creation strategies and synergies Assess and provide productive suggestions to prepare for operational integration/carve-out and improve readiness to execute the transaction Recommend services, costing and pricing to be included in the Transaction Service Agreement (TSAs) including services required to be duplicated (buy vs. build) Advise the client throughout the transaction process, specifically on chartering, detailed transition planning, synergy capture, functional integration/carve-out, measuring monitoring, communication and other (supply chain, back office shared services) Analyze underlying assumptions to build synergy, cost (stand-alone, continuing and one-time estimates) Prepare clear, compelling work products summarizing our recommendations to the client Develop knowledge and substantial experience in relevant industry sectors Build broad and deep internal and external networks and spot firm- wide sales opportunities Manage and build high performing teams and deliver exceptional client service  Qualifications   To qualify, candidates must have:   Strong track record in management consulting from a recognised consulting firm and/or big 4 Transaction experience and strong technical skills in relevant areas such as pre-deal transaction support, commercial and operational due diligence, synergy identification and assessment, post - merger integration or carve-out support and benefits realisation Business development and client management skills Ability to adapt to a constantly changing and growing business environment

JobTitle: Performance Improvement, Manager (Credit Risk Modeller), Financial Services, Advisory, Singapore
JobText: Job Description - Performance Improvement, Manager (Credit Risk Modeller), Financial Services, Advisory, Singapore (SIN00345)Job Description Performance Improvement, Manager (Credit Risk Modeller), Financial Services, Advisory, Singapore - SIN00345SG-All-Singapore We are the only professional services organisation who has a separate business dedicated exclusively to the financial services marketplace. Join Financial Services (FSO) and you will work with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world to deliver a global perspective. Aligned to key industry groups including asset management, banking and capital markets, insurance and private equity, we provide integrated advisory, assurance, tax, and transaction services.   The opportunity   EY’s Performance Improvement Advisory professionals bring a wealth of experience in working with major financial institutions to align their operating model and infrastructure to their business’ strategic objectives. We assemble the right multi-disciplinary teams, use consistent and proven global methodologies and tools, and draw on the full breadth of EY’s global network, to deliver value and trusted advice to the clients. The key service offerings cover finance function transformation, customer and distribution effectiveness, operations, shared services / outsourcing support, performance management, program advisory, enterprise intelligence, risk management and regulatory change.   Your key responsibilities As markets rapidly change and develop, finance functions must demonstrate real added value to their business. As a finance advisor, you’ll use your experience and knowledge to help deliver greater insight – delivering functional efficiencies as well as transforming the role of finance in our clients’ businesses. You’ll be developing innovative, sustainable ways to improve the management of people, processes and systems, working alongside other finance professionals in high-performing teams.   Skills and attributes for success Good understanding of economic or market issues and the ability to interpret their impact on clients Strong analytical, problem-solving and communication skills Leverage technology to continually learn, improve service delivery and maintain our leading edge best practices Strong presentation skills and proficiency in the use of PowerPoint, Word and Excel To qualify for the role you must have Minimum 7 years of financial services experience, with 5 years’ experience in design and deployment of logical and physical structures in Banking Risk and Regulatory area (finance and treasury) Previous exposure of IBM data modelling tool (IBM InfoSphere) or any other industry standard data modelling tools Experience in following activities Develop Probability of Default and Loss Given Default risk rating models for commercial & corporate borrowers Develop time series Stress Test models to support capital planning initiatives Support performance monitoring and model validation. Assist in establishing, monitoring, evaluating and interpreting data with a risk management focus with an understanding of business strategy. Demonstrate working knowledge of Credit Risk databases to provide data and analytical support to Senior Management. Perform data manipulation and analysis using SQL, SAS and other tools and present results and recommendations to Credit Risk Management. Identify deviations from forecast/expectations and explain variances. Identify risk and/or opportunities. Identify opportunities to leverage statistical solutions to solve business problem and present results to Senior and Executive Management. Understand and adhere to the clients’ risk and regulatory standards, policies and controls in accordance with the clients’ risk Appetite. Identify risk-related issues needing escalation to management. Ideally, you’ll also have Good understanding of Enterprise Architecture (i.e. TOGAF qualified) would be desirable Track record dealing with senior stakeholders and adapting to demanding environments What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization   What working at EY offers We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you: Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

JobTitle: Associates, Engagement Auditors and Senior Auditors - Assurance
JobText: Job Description - Associates, Engagement Auditors and Senior Auditors - Assurance (DUB002QA)Job Description Associates, Engagement Auditors and Senior Auditors - Assurance - DUB002QAAE-All-DubaiFrom small businesses to some of the world’s best-known brands, our clients count on reliable financial statements, information and processes to inform their on-going strategies. More than ever, business is about interpreting and reacting to complex data - and they look to us for advice and services they can trust every time. You will use your professional skills and experience to make it happen, handling complex audit procedures across a broad range of industries and responsibilities.   The opportunity   We are currently seeking Associates, Engagement Auditors and Senior Auditors to support our Audit team and help our clients meet their requirements by accurately reporting on financial statements and providing meaningful insights into accounting and reporting matters. In return, you can expect leading-class learning and development tailored to your unique interests and motivations. You will be given all the skills, knowledge and opportunities to progress and become ready to build a better working world for our people, our clients and the communities that support us.   Your key responsibilities   As an External Auditor in EY, you will make a technical contribution to audit client engagements and internal projects. Within your role, you will actively establish, maintain and strengthen internal and external relationships, execute complex assurance procedures, supervise junior engagement team members and help define the audit strategy. Working under the supervision of senior team members, you will help execute our work and present its findings to the client.   Skills and attributes for success   Supporting the planning, execution and delivery of assurance engagements Working effectively as a team member on all audit related fieldwork and updating senior team members on progress Assisting with the preparation of memoranda, working papers, letters and correspondence Drafting financial statements and foot­note disclosures in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles Constantly developing your understanding of current market trends and processes and sharing your knowledge to develop junior colleagues Developing and maintaining productive working relationships with client personnel Building strong internal relationships within Assurance and across other services  To qualify for the role you must have Approximately 1 - 5 years of audit working experience Strong academic record including a Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field Professional accountancy qualification or working towards gaining one (CA , ACCA or CPA qualified Familiarity with IFRS and local GAAP Excellent communication and prioritization skills Strong teamwork and leadership/project management skills Results-oriented approach with keen attention to high quality, details and accuracy Self-motivation and desire to exceed expectations Eligibility to travel in accordance with client and other job requirements both locally and internationally   Ideally you will also have   Track record with a leading audit firm Proficiency in the Arabic language Sector experience in one or more of the following: Construction, Energy, Financial Services,  Government & Public Sector, Healthcare   What we look for We are interested in leaders with a genuine creative vision and the confidence to make it happen. You can expect plenty of autonomy in this role, so you will also need the ability to take initiative and seek out opportunities to improve our current relationships and processes. If you are serious about auditing and ready to take on some of our clients’ most complex issues, this role is for you. What working at EY offers Support, feedback and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career in the MENA region Developed system of performance management and career development that enables you to have the freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you Opportunity to work in an international environment   About EY   As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

JobTitle: (4.5 months contract) Senior Marketing Executive, CBS, Singapore
JobText: Job Description - (4.5 months contract) Senior Marketing Executive, CBS, Singapore (SIN00343)Job Description (4.5 months contract) Senior Marketing Executive, CBS, Singapore - SIN00343SG-All-Singapore Join our Brand, Marketing and Communications (BMC) team and you will directly support and promote our brand and reputation. Through internal communications, public relations and corporate communications, you’ll provide a wide range of marketing and communications services to internal and external audiences. These include current and future clients, our current and future employees, alumni, regulators, the media and the communities within which we operate.   With so many offerings, you have the opportunity to develop your career through a broad scope of engagements, mentoring and formal learning. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. Sound interesting? Well this is just the beginning. Because whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.    The opportunity    You’ll be part of the Brand, Marketing and Communications (BMC) team and will assist the Director of Brand, Marketing and Communications in managing the firm’s Go-to-Market (GTM) buyer programs buyer across service lines and sectors.      Your key responsibilities Providing support to the Director and other team members Working collaboratively across the local BMC team and business units to support and execute GTM buyer-based or sector-based programs, working closely with the various internal and external stakeholders Effectively manage multiple projects, balancing these with business-as-usual responsibilities    Skills and attributes for success  Demonstrating strong attention to detail, analytical skills and pro-activeness,  and the ability to challenge and persuade others Prioritizing own workload and proactively manage stakeholder expectations; effectively balance multiple priorities, projects and business-as-usual tasks A strong team player with a flexible can-do attitude and good interpersonal skills; demonstrate commitment to meeting deadlines and supporting colleagues Working under own initiative with minimal supervision and direction Good organization skills and able to multitask Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills     To qualify for the role you must have A bachelor’s degree At least 5 years of relevant experience in a brand, marketing or communications role in a large organization Experience working with multiple stakeholders in multiple geographies Experience in project management Experience working as part of diverse and virtual high-performance teams Ability to influence and build collaborative relationships with business stakeholders Must be able to start work as soon as possible    Ideally, you'll also have  Worked in a consulting/advisory environment   What we look for   What’s most important is that you’re dedicated to supporting your colleagues and stakeholders as part of a high-performing team. You’ll need to thrive in picking up new skills and talents as you go, so natural curiosity, a lot of questions and the confidence to speak up when you see something that could be improved are essential. If you’ve got the right combination of technical knowledge and communication skills, this role is for you.     What working at EY offers   EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY   As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world.   Apply today.   Want to get to know us better?   Visit www.ey.com/SG/careers Become a fan on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/eycareerssingapore Connect with us on Linked In: http://bit.ly/EYLinked_Careers Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/EY_Singapore Watch us on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/ernstandyoungglobal

JobTitle: (2 years contract) Associate/Senior Associate, Performance Improvement, Advisory, Singapore
JobText: Job Description - (2 years contract) Associate/Senior Associate, Performance Improvement, Advisory, Singapore (SIN0034A)Job Description (2 years contract) Associate/Senior Associate, Performance Improvement, Advisory, Singapore - SIN0034ASingapore Our clients operate in a world where achieving and sustaining performance is more difficult than ever. As a performance improvement professional, you will be focused on helping them grow and turn their strategy into reality. You’ll work in high-performing teams that drive growth and deliver exceptional client service, ensuring you play your part in building a better working world.    Your career is yours to shape. Whether you’re in Customer, Supply Chain and Operations, Finance, IT Advisory, Strategy or People and Organizational Change, we’ll support you to develop the skills, knowledge and experience to succeed.   The strength of our global network, combined with local empowerment and a relentless focus on winning in specific markets, mean you’ll gain valuable experience across different geographies and sectors. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.  The opportunity   As a program management practitioner at EY, you’ll help organizations deliver successful outcomes for some of the world's largest and most complex programs.  Working in a globally integrated team, you can also work in a variety of industry sectors.   The opportunity to shape your career is yours - whether your passion lies in helping a Government organization to successfully build a power plant or in working with an Investment Bank to implement an organization-wide Enterprise Resource Planning system.      Your key responsibilities Developing and proposing researched solutions for the clients and implement real-life business cases Working with stakeholders at all levels Gain experience in project, customer-relationship and team management Building and broadening personal competencies in data analysis, market research, project management, business process re-engineering and performance consulting Have opportunities to grow your career in a fast expanding globalized company   Skills and attributes for success Taking a lead in developing recommendations and implementation plans. Good verbal/written communication skills Strong organizational, project management and analytical skills.     To qualify for the role you must have Resourceful, self-motivated, have strong entrepreneurial spirit, good team player and good communication skills Possess at least 1 - 2 years of related working experience for Senior Associate. Possess at least a diploma or degree in any discipline NS men (active or non-active) who are military officers or staff sergeants (or above) with command or staff appointment experience in the Singapore Armed Forces are highly encouraged to apply Skills in use of Microsoft Office Word, Excel and Powerpoint    Ideally, you also have Background or qualifications in Instructional Design Multi-media work experience and knowledge     What we look for   Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.     What working at EY offers   EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you     About EY   As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world.   Apply today.   Want to get to know us better?   Visit www.ey.com/SG/careers Become a fan on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/eycareerssingapore Connect with us on Linked In: http://bit.ly/EYLinked_Careers Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/EY_Singapore Watch us on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/ernstandyoungglobal

JobTitle: Associate/Senior Associate (Curriculum Review Team), Performance Improvement, Advisory, Singapore
JobText: Job Description - Associate/Senior Associate (Curriculum Review Team), Performance Improvement, Advisory, Singapore (SIN0034B)Job Description Associate/Senior Associate (Curriculum Review Team), Performance Improvement, Advisory, Singapore - SIN0034BSG-All-Singapore Our clients operate in a world where achieving and sustaining performance is more difficult than ever. As a performance improvement professional, you will be focused on helping them grow and turn their strategy into reality. You’ll work in high-performing teams that drive growth and deliver exceptional client service, ensuring you play your part in building a better working world.    Your career is yours to shape. Whether you’re in Customer, Supply Chain and Operations, Finance, IT Advisory, Strategy or People and Organizational Change, we’ll support you to develop the skills, knowledge and experience to succeed.   The strength of our global network, combined with local empowerment and a relentless focus on winning in specific markets, mean you’ll gain valuable experience across different geographies and sectors. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.    The opportunity   As part of our Performance Improvement team, you will work with leading multinational organizations and public sector agencies to deliver innovative and sustainable improvements in business performance You’ll help organizations deliver successful outcomes for some of the world's largest and most complex programs.  Working in a globally integrated team, you can also work in a variety of industry sectors.     Your key responsibilities Conducting curriculum exercises Integrating the curriculum exercises together with various teams Assisting in the supervision of the development of a curriculum framework Working with various teams to design curriculum and content    Skills and attributes for success Good verbal/written communication skills Strong organizational, project management and analytical skills. Good team player     To qualify for the role you must have Diploma or equivalent in any management discipline with at least 1 - 2 years of related working experience, AND Diploma or higher in Adult and Continuing Education or equivalent qualification Fluent in both written and spoken English and strong presentation skills    Ideally, you also have   Designing curriculum and content work experience and knowledge   What we look for   Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What working at EY offers   EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:   Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY   As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world.   Apply today.     Want to get to know us better?   Visit www.ey.com/SG/careers Become a fan on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/eycareerssingapore Connect with us on Linked In: http://bit.ly/EYLinked_Careers Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/EY_Singapore Watch us on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/ernstandyoungglobal

Job Description - Senior Analyst, ISC HR (1706988)Job Description Senior Analyst, ISC HR(Job Number: 1706988)Description Mondelez International LLC is a US$26 billion snacking powerhouse with operations in more than 80 countries and our brands marketed in 165 countries. It’s a great time to join us; we employ over 100,000 people around the world and are a company full of the world’s favorite brands - Cadbury Dairy Milk, Philadelphia and The Natural Confectionery Company to name just a few. As well as the countless opportunities our business brings, we have fantastic people who do amazing things for our business and their own careers, every day.  9 months contract role.Financial “forensics”, target realization and budget management linked to:ZBB People cost packages for AMEA region (Intergrated Supply Chain and Intergrated Supply Chain Human Resource)Budget management related to Intergrated Supply Chain HR spend on non people cost packagesThis role will require tight linkage with multiple teams across finance and HR, such asOverhead ControllingIntergrated Supply Chain FinanceRewards teamIntergrated Supply Chain HR Business Lead Duties include:Work with finance to ensure expenses are being recorded accurately, track cross charges and follow up on accruals and reclassifications neededSupport HR Controller in:Supply chain and manufacturing HR Headcount/FTE reporting and management, including vacanciesTrack monthly overheads (People (AMEA ISC) and non people (AMEA ISC HR) vs. budget and ensure deliveryDevelopment of action plans to deliver savings targetsEnsure HR Leaders have clarity on budget spent and budget leftWork on cost projections and scenarios as neededAnalytics relating to Rewards assumptionManage creation and tracking for Appropriation requests relating to Supply Chain projects having people impactsQualifications Do you have what it takes? Business degree in Accounting or Finance, M.B.A. preferred.Minimum 6 years of working experience with 3-5 years in Finance or Accounting Management or Rewards experienceGood analytical and communication skills, collaboration and partnership within Finance and HROrientation towards details and driving results, proactive, resourcefulExtensive practical system knowledge (SAP/Other Costing Systems, advanced Excel)Strong team player who manages collaboratively with all stakeholdersStrong influencing and communication skills, and ability to lead informal teamsProfessional accounting designation CPA, CMA, CGA and/or MBA in Accounting/Finance would be an asset.Self-starter, stand-aloneDemonstrated Project and Change Management abilities For more information, please visit:http://www.mondelezinternational.com/ and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternationalPrimary Location: AMEA-SG-Singapore-SingaporeJob: Talent Mgmt, Org Effectiveness & ChangeSchedule: Full-time

Job Description - Workforce Administration Tier2 Junior Specialist (1707112)Job Description Workforce Administration Tier2 Junior Specialist(Job Number: 1707112)Description  Mondelez International LLC is a US$26 billion snacking powerhouse with operations in more than 80 countries and our brands marketed in 165 countries. It’s a great time to join us; we employ over 100,000 people around the world and are a company full of the world’s favorite brands - Cadbury Dairy Milk, Philadelphia and The Natural Confectionery Company to name just a few. As well as the countless opportunities our business brings, we have fantastic people who do amazing things for our business and their own careers, every day.   Reporting to the Workforce Admin (T2) Team Lead, the Workforce Admin (T2) Junior Specialist is responsible for providing subject matter expertise on relevant HR processes and perform administrative/ transactional activities (e. g. HR database transactions) Some of the key accountabilities for this role will include (but are not limited to): Receives and manages employee data maintenance requests such as employee relationship change, mass uploads, individual data correction for personal/non-personal data, employee category change, pay/work schedules, effective date changes and execution of reversals; updates SHARP a/or case as applicable Processes and seeks approval for workforce administration requests including short term disability, military leave, personal leave (paid and unpaid), promotions, lateral moves, future downgrades, tuition reimbursements, performance rewards, severances, involuntary and voluntary separations; initiates payroll request and confirms payment when applicable Works with Disability Case Coordinator to maintain Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) cases updated; Tracks and maintains non-continuous, non-disability leaves (FMLA) Processes verification letters for third party vendors and invitation letters for visa Prepares and sends letters on reorganization to managers; post announcement Creates death announcement and letter of condolence together with manager and HRM; notifies payroll and other stakeholders Conducts exit interview for employees in salary grade 9 and below Compiles data on mass termination tracking for to meet geographic legislative requirements (eg California) Fulfills audit requests by providing SHARP HR and Payroll data/transactions Processes request for organizational announcements (non F+ positions voluntary separations, involuntary separations, new joiner and reorganization) and publish Processes request for unemployment claims with third party vendor; ensure HRM receives information through third party system Updates cases in case management tool and information in SHARP as neededQualifications Do you have what it takes? 3-4 years general work experience (HR and Data/Process management preferred) Experience of working with SAP or equivalent database required Experienced in local employment standards and employment laws Experience working in a shared service organization Ability to influence line managers and advocate for the right course of action Ability to plan and manage a variety of people processes Able to multi-task and manage a fluctuating workload with large volumes Skilled with technology and technical tools (e.g. case management tool, HR databases) Able to work under pressure and learn quickly Able to work collaboratively as part of a team Customer-focused and detail oriented Fluent in EnglishExcellent problem solving and judgment skills Highly computer literate, knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project For more information, please visit:http://www.mondelezinternational.com/ and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternationalPrimary Location: AMEA-PH-NCR Manulla-Quezon CityJob: Employee Services OperationsSchedule: Full-time

Job Description - Manager, Corporate & Government Affaires Japan (1705717)Job Description Manager, Corporate & Government Affaires Japan(Job Number: 1705717)Description The AMEA CGA team is on the front line of MDLZ AMEA’s ambitious growth agenda helping to promote the latest innovations and investments in the region; keeping our people engaged in the transformation and partnering with government to ensure we can make the necessary changes to our operating model and ways of working.  Specific responsibilities for the Manager, CGA Japan include:   Media relations Establish and nurture strong relationships with Tier 1 corporate media in Japan Leverage MDLZ’s iconic brands and senior executives to drive coverage that  promotes MDLZ’s growth agenda and leadership in snacking, well-being and e-commerce  Support marketing teams to safeguard the rich heritage of our iconic brands and introduce the latest innovations (Note: Brand PR is delivered by marketing, CGA plays a supporting role offering strategic advice and managing interactions with Tier 1 media) Collaborate with HR to build the MDLZ employer brand and support regional recruitment needs Oversee the press office and ensure timely handling of all media enquiries Contribute to the MDLZ corporate external digital/social media channels including website, Facebook and Twitter Represent MDLZ as a spokesperson and provide media training for other senior leaders     Public & Government Affairs (PGA) Establish and nurture strong relationships with national and local government and stakeholders Identify and address short-term barriers to trade by monitoring the external environment and influencing regulations or proposals which impact our license to operate Work directly and with trade associations to influence the long-term policy debate on MDLZ global priority issues (well-being, food safety, tax and trade, sustainability, retail environment) Enable business growth by working with government and stakeholders to secure necessary approvals and/or financial incentives for new projects     Internal communications Oversee all internal communications to ensure Japanese colleagues understand corporate strategy and business performance (includes quarterly region town halls, monthly ‘open house’ sessions, email updates from the market leader, intranet content, seasonal celebration events) Work with the General Manager and Leadership Team to develop and communicate market priorities Play a leadership role in the design and delivery of the annual Management & Sales Conference for senior leaders Coach leaders and line managers on effective communications   Transformation Lead all communications and government engagement around local transformation projects including supply chain reinvention, acquisitions and divestments   Community engagement: Oversee the delivery of local community projects promoting healthy lifestyles Deliver volunteering opportunities to enable employees to make a difference in their local communities Leverage community engagement activity to drive our reputation with media and stakeholders   Leadership Team Represent CGA on the Japan Leadership Team providing advice and guidance as a functional specialist and enterprise leader   Special Situations Management Team (SSMT): Represent CGA on the Japan SSMT providing advice on interactions with media and government in the event of a special situation eg product recall, industrial action/employee protest, accident on site   People management Build capabilities across the team and create a culture of growth and development Have fun while we work!   Budget managementOversee delivery of Japan CGA budget and Business Events & Communications cost packageQualifications  Knowledge: including education, qualifications and training   Master’s Degree, preferably in business or public administration   Preferred     Skills/Leadership Competencies   Result-oriented and hand-on mentality Required   Ability to work under pressure with a sense of diplomacy Required   Strategic orientation combined with a strong analytical & conceptual thinking Required   Dealing with ambiguity Required   Change agility Required   Excellent time management and priority setting Required   Attention to detail Required   Understanding and sharing vision and company direction Required       Experience   Minimum of 8-10 years experience in communications, including experience in government affairs and issues management Required   Work experience in  PR agency   Preferred Previous work experience in a large, matrixed multinational   Preferred     Languages   Excellent English Required   Native Level in Japanese Required  Primary Location: AMEA-JP-Tokyo-Shinagawa-kuJob: Corporate & Govt Affairs ManagementSchedule: Full-time
