JobTitle: maintenance mechanic, Carson Valley Roasting Plant - Minden, NV
JobText: Job Description - maintenance mechanic, Carson Valley Roasting Plant - Minden, NV (170021127)Job Description maintenance mechanic, Carson Valley Roasting Plant - Minden, NV (Job Number: 170021127) Location: US-NV-Minden-Carson Valley Roast Plant Starbucks - Maintenance/Automation Job Summary and Mission This job contributes to Starbucks success by ensuring that plant equipment is repaired and maintained in a timely manner.   Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles.   Summary of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Assists maintenance team and supports all aspects of the maintenance department as needed, including general building and grounds maintenance. Assists with the installation of all new equipment. Completes documentation, including drawings, schematics, parts lists and work orders. Completes plant work orders and preventive maintenance. Ensures all plant equipment is functioning at optimum levels by performing short-term repairs and long-term improvements. Maintains regular and consistent attendance and punctuality. Performs all other duties necessary for the efficient maintenance of the plant and equipment as assigned, including general building and grounds maintenance.Summary of Experience Automated manufacturing or distribution environment (5 years) General industrial maintenance in mechanical and electrical (5 years) Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Ability to communicate technical and operational issues clearly and concisely Ability to lift 50 pounds Ability to read, write and understand polices, guidelines, specifications and safety standards Ability to troubleshoot electrical and mechanical plant equipment Ability to understand and create mechanical and electrical blueprints and technical equipment manuals Ability to work in elevated areas Ability to work independently and make decisions with minimal supervision Basic math skills Knowledge of welding, plumbing and machining Attention to detail Proficient in safety procedures Familiarity with American Institute of Baking (AIB), Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), and Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP) standards Ability to plan and prioritize workload Ability to work in accordance with quality, safety, and sanitation standards, policies and guidelines Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, veterans & individuals with disabilities. Starbucks will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local ordinances.

JobTitle: maintenance mechanic, Carson Valley Roasting Plant - Minden, NV
JobText: Job Description - maintenance mechanic, Carson Valley Roasting Plant - Minden, NV (170021127)Job Description maintenance mechanic, Carson Valley Roasting Plant - Minden, NV (Job Number: 170021127) Location: US-NV-Minden-Carson Valley Roast Plant Starbucks - Maintenance/Automation Job Summary and Mission This job contributes to Starbucks success by ensuring that plant equipment is repaired and maintained in a timely manner.   Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles.   Summary of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Assists maintenance team and supports all aspects of the maintenance department as needed, including general building and grounds maintenance. Assists with the installation of all new equipment. Completes documentation, including drawings, schematics, parts lists and work orders. Completes plant work orders and preventive maintenance. Ensures all plant equipment is functioning at optimum levels by performing short-term repairs and long-term improvements. Maintains regular and consistent attendance and punctuality. Performs all other duties necessary for the efficient maintenance of the plant and equipment as assigned, including general building and grounds maintenance.Summary of Experience Automated manufacturing or distribution environment (5 years) General industrial maintenance in mechanical and electrical (5 years) Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Ability to communicate technical and operational issues clearly and concisely Ability to lift 50 pounds Ability to read, write and understand polices, guidelines, specifications and safety standards Ability to troubleshoot electrical and mechanical plant equipment Ability to understand and create mechanical and electrical blueprints and technical equipment manuals Ability to work in elevated areas Ability to work independently and make decisions with minimal supervision Basic math skills Knowledge of welding, plumbing and machining Attention to detail Proficient in safety procedures Familiarity with American Institute of Baking (AIB), Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), and Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP) standards Ability to plan and prioritize workload Ability to work in accordance with quality, safety, and sanitation standards, policies and guidelines Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, veterans & individuals with disabilities. Starbucks will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local ordinances.

JobTitle: head baker, Princi Kitchen - Seattle, WA
JobText: Job Description - head baker, Princi Kitchen - Seattle, WA (170003077)Job Description head baker, Princi Kitchen - Seattle, WA (Job Number: 170003077) Location: US-WA-Seattle-Starbucks Support Center Starbucks - Business Strategy Now Baking – Head Baker, Princi Kitchen- SeattleFrom the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that celebrates coffee, it’s rich tradition, and a feeling of connection.  Continuing our quest in 2016, we announced a partnership with Princi, a renowned boutique bakery and café founded by Rocco Princi in 1986. Known for its artisan breads created from traditional family recipes, Princi’s five locations have become beloved experiences for customers across Milan and London. Through the shared values for handcrafted experiences, Starbucks will expand standalone Princi specialty stores and begin including fresh baking in Starbucks Roasteries and Reserve stores, with the first opening being in Seattle, WA in 2017.  In order to bring this vision to life we will begin opening Princi Kitchens to prepare all of the food served in Roasteries, Reserve Stores and Princi Bakeries.  The newly hired kitchen team will continue to bring to life the Princi brand by creating handcrafted foods such as pastries, cakes, fresh soups, salads and focaccia-style pizza as well as artisanal baked breads. Join us on this special journey!The Princi Kitchen Head Baker role will have a unique and exciting opportunity to open our first kitchen and help to create and refine how we bring Princi to life in our stores.  The candidate for this role must have an unwavering focus on baking production and quality.  He/she will be responsible for managing baking personnel and assisting with the preparation of baked goods.  This candidate will manage inventory, training, labor and equipment maintenance per need of the kitchen.As the Head Baker, Princi Kitchen, you’ll be able to apply your past culinary leadership experience to:Food Production LeadershipOversees and prepares bread, croissant, brioche, pizza & focaccia dough, laminated breads, rolls, muffins, and potentially cookies, pies, cakes, doughnuts, cookies and other pastries, including icings and frostings, according to established recipesSupports and performs cutting and weighing of dough into uniform portions with knife or divider, molds dough into loaves or other shapes, and places in pans; proofs dough and bakes in oven using peel; inspects product for quality during and after baking and adjusts processes as requiredResponsible for receiving ingredients and other supplies from main kitchen and/or pantry as required for daily operationsWorks closely with other kitchen leaders and staff to ensure effective production of itemsPlanning & PrioritizingReviews production schedules to determine variety and quantity of goods to bake and to assemble supplies and equipment needed for daily baking activitiesCompletes production sheets and other records as requiredCoaching Performance & DevelopmentResponsible for hiring and managing baking teamDevelop leaders through meaningful coaching conversations informed by observed performanceCulture & Effective Communication Set inspirational tone for partners by role modeling Starbucks Mission and Values along with the Princi visionSummary of ExperiencesDemonstrated baking and pastry expertise (6 years)Baking Management (2 years)Current Self-Safe certification and local health certification experience (2-3 years)Superior performer who represents the Starbucks Mission Statement in daily workDemonstrated agility in dealing with ambiguity associated with working in a fast paced, highly visible, and changing environmentAble to organize and deploy work across peopleExcellent coach and role model of Starbucks & Princi culture and valuesDemonstrates strong abilities as a team player and leaderAbility to build strong relationships and engage across differing cultures and societies Training experience    Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, women, veterans & individuals with disabilities. Starbucks will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local ordinances.

JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), the Solutions Delivery MD is responsible for the strategic implementation of technology solutions that improve business efficiency, enable commercialization and de-risk the franchise while meeting S&P business goals. Represents the needs of the business to IT by working closely with the business to gain in-depth understanding of their strategy, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which the business operates. Serves as the liaison and bridges the gap between the business and IT by gaining insight and domain knowledge into the customer’s current and future states in order to recommend technology solutions that align IT with the customer’s business strategy. Improves communication and collaboration, identifies technologies and improvement opportunities, and ensures teams are aligned to meet overall business goals. Leads all matters related to the assessment and delivery of technology needs for the business, to include defining requirements, setting expectations, collaborating with various parties, and implementing technical solutions necessary to meet S&P’s mission, objectives, emerging issues, and future needs. Influencing a diverse set of constituents, and understanding, reengineering and running processes across the entire enterprise. The Solutions Delivery MD manages relationships to set expectations, keeps communication channels open between business personnel and IT, and communicates regularly with internal customers at all levels. Serves as an IT expert adviser by providing up-to-date technical expertise for a wide range of information technology issues and operations. Collaborates regularly with IT management to ensure new ideas are assessed within the context of business, data, application development, and system architectures. Responsibilities: Drive the development of, implementation of, and adherence to strategic initiatives within the specific IT discipline for the company. Involve senior executives in the development and understanding of the plans and initiatives and help manage the IT team in the execution of the plan. Promote an organization that is user focused and renders outstanding customer service, high performance, teamwork, and accountability. Ensure that roles and responsibilities are clear for all team members and establish goals, objectives, and operating procedures. Drive the identification and delivery of the various tactical initiatives and tasks that support the execution of the approved strategies for S&P. Provide effective leadership and exercise day-to-day management of assigned staff. Set priorities among competing goals and objectives and coordinates simultaneous workflows to ensure efficient contribution to S&P objectives. Develop, implement and maintain policies in conjunction with S&P stakeholders to ensure the effective and efficient identification, acquisition and management of technologies. Define and execute an information management strategy to advance the vision and mission of S&P. Develop and manage IT related project plans, budgets and performance targets, including the management of the related employee and contractor workforce. Contribute to and support S&P enterprise architecture, information security and IT strategic plans, including documentation of the current state and future state, and establishment and management of migration plan to achieve future improvements in efficiency and effectiveness. Approve multi-year and long range work plans and assist in the management of the overall IT portfolio. Qualifications: Must possess a Bachelor’s degree, Master’s Degree preferred; 15+ years of experience with a minimum of 10 years of technical leadership and at least 5 years of business development experience; Demonstrated experience in a strategic, leadership role in at least one of the following areas: client relations, communications, information technology, and/or operations; Very strong relationship-building, exceptional analytical, interpersonal and communications skills; as well as the ability to influence decision-makers and stakeholders; Significant understanding of workflow processes with the ability to identify weaknesses and implement process improvements; Outstanding program and project management skills, organizational skills, execution planning and control competency; Proven ability to motivate and develop staff and build high-performing teams; Proven ability in providing excellent customer service while recognizing the challenges of driving and embedding change in a rapidly moving environment; Proven ability to work to defined deadlines and prioritize workload; Proven ability to develop positive working relationships, both internal and external, and to be seen as a highly credible representative of the business. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role The role provides the opportunity to work on cutting edge projects in the field of sustainable finance. The senior research analyst will be a key member of the Financial Institutions Delivery Team, dedicated to the support and development of Trucost’s services to banks, asset managers and pension funds globally. The analyst will carry out research on the environmental performance, risks and opportunities related to companies, investment products and how this translates into financial and societal impact for investors. The Impact The analyst will contribute to and be responsible for managing a broad range of research projects, including those of a bespoke nature and consultancy work. They will also work with the business development managers in managing client relationships and be involved in some sales support work including technical input for proposals and meetings with prospective clients. The role is client facing with the opportunity for travel. The Career Opportunity •In depth research on companies, industry sectors, regions, economies and thematics to report to the investment community. •Analyse the environmental performance and opportunities of investment products and portfolios using Trucost’s proprietary methods. •Research and update financial and environmental information on global listed companies using Trucost’s proprietary database. •Account Management – working with clients to advise on the integration and use of Trucost data and research in their investment and due diligence processes, and product creation; support them in the use of Trucost’s data and software, and answer technical questions. •Project Management of research delivery projects. •Representing Trucost at meetings with prospects alongside the business development manager, effectively recognising their needs and conveying Trucost’s value proposition. •Product development: identifying opportunities within the financial sector for applying Trucost’s data and analytics. The Team/Business S&P Dow Jones, a division of S&P Global, is the world's largest resource for index-based innovation, data and research. S&P Dow Jones Indices is at the forefront of index change and innovation, and has over 115 years of experience constructing innovative and transparent solutions that help investors achieve their financial goals. For more information, visit https://www.spglobal.com/ We are seeking a rigorous, hard worker, motivated and skilled team-player candidate who can demonstrate a high level of customer service and support the sales team in all queries in order to respond to customers and to maintain and enhance the quality and timeliness of our offerings. Qualifications•1+ years of experience •Working experience working in a financial institution in a role with exposure to corporate lending in a bank, credit risk, fundamental equities or corporate fixed income analysis or similar viewed favorably. •Ideally the candidate would also have environmental or ESG experience. This could include working as an analyst within an asset manager, pension fund or bank, helping to integrate environmental factors into the investment or lending decision making processes. Other relevant experience would include working as an ESG/RI analyst for a research provider or in the sustainability field for a management consultancy or Development Finance Institution. •The candidate must have a strong understanding of financial markets and investing, as well as knowledge of some of the following sustainability areas that financial institutions are involved in, such as, mainstreaming ESG integration, environmental fund or index creation, environmental risk analysis, green finance and reporting of investments in different asset classes. •The candidate must have excellent project management skills and be capable of leading complex projects in a client facing capacity and managing others within their project team. •Ideally the candidate would have an undergraduate and post graduate degree in relevant subjects such as; Economics, Finance, Environmental Economics, Development Economics or Environmental Sciences but this is not critical if work experience is very relevant. •Advanced Excel spreadsheet skills are required. •Fluent written and spoken English. Additional languages will be considered favorably. About S&P Dow Jones Indices At S&P Dow Jones Indices, our role can be described in one word: essential. We’re the largest global resource for index-based concepts, data and research, and home to iconic financial market indicators, such as the S&P 500® and the Dow Jones Industrial Average®. More assets are invested in products based upon our indices than any other index provider in the world; with over 1,000,000 indices, S&P Dow Jones Indices defines the way people measure and trade the markets. We provide essential intelligence that helps investors identify and capitalize on global opportunities. S&P Dow Jones Indices is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spdji.com To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Job Description Senior Analyst, Corporate Business Division, Trucost The Role: Trucost, a leader in environmental data and risk analysis, is seeking a Senior Analyst to join its global Corporate Business division. Working from the US, this role is dedicated to completing analysis tasks and delivering Trucost’s services to its global client base. The Senior Analyst will contribute technical expertise and lead teams conducting detailed ESG analyses across a broad range of client projects - focused primarily on measuring the ESG performance of companies across their products, services, operations and supply chains. The Opportunity: In this role, you will be working with clients in a diverse range of sectors to support the disclosure and management of ESG risks and opportunities, and benchmark performance. You will support clients to meet reporting needs in line with international and sector specific reporting standards and best practices. The Impact: Trucost’s expertise is providing data leveraged analytics and insights on corporate ESG performance so that businesses and investors can understand how to direct investments that create value and avoid risk. We’ve been informing companies, financial institutions, regulators and thought leaders since 2000. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with clients across many different sectors and geographies. The Team: Our team is composed of experienced professionals driven to identify the transformative solutions of tomorrow. The business has a casual and friendly atmosphere with an entrepreneurial spirit. We value team work and it is crucial that you are a team player in order to be successful within our organization. The Hiring Manager says: “I am looking for a Senior Analyst with an excellent understanding of the development of ESG metrics and how they can be applied to support business and investment decision-making. You must be passionate about helping businesses to understand their ESG risks and opportunities, to enable and enhance their decision making processes and build more sustainable business models”. Key responsibilities: Lead and participate in an international research team conducting in-depth analytical research on the ESG performance of companies across their operations, supply chains and products Develop technical approaches to meet client needs Provide high-quality insights and recommendations from complex information for consultative projects Clearly communicate insights and technical approaches to clients verbally and in writing, including documenting analytical methodologies for reports and developing graphs and charts appropriate for use by senior executives Support Corporate Business division account managers in developing technical approaches for proposals or RFP/RFI responses that recognize client needs and convey Trucost’s value proposition Work collaboratively with a diverse team across multiple locations to conduct research and ensure the quality of assessment findings Essential skills Experience developing and applying ESG metrics to support business and investment decision-making Excellent project management skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including confidently presenting complex information to clients in ways that they can easily understand and inform their actions Personable, with a demonstrated strength in planning and executing work assignments independently, and as part of an international research team Self-motivated, organized, detail-oriented, with a positive, “can do” attitude Preferred Experience Proven professional work experience An undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline, which includes business, economics and finance, natural resource economics and environmental sciences, with a post-graduate degree in a related subject A background in environmental research, preferably with an environmental consultancy, including technical experience conducting environmental footprinting, life cycle assessment (LCA), Environmentally Extended Input-Output (EEI-O) Modelling or supply chain environmental impact analysis A good understanding of business and how sustainability can be integrated into corporate decision-making related to: Procurement, risk management, environmental reporting, and product or supply chain optimization Demonstrated ability to synthesize technical data to develop business insights on corporate environmental and financial performance The candidate should be conscious of detail and numerically proficient with natural curiosity, and an innovative approach to problem solving. Advanced word-processing and spreadsheet skills are expected Fluency in additional languages (in particular Spanish, German, French, or Mandarin) will be looked upon favourably About S&P Dow Jones Indices At S&P Dow Jones Indices, our role can be described in one word: essential. We’re the largest global resource for index-based concepts, data and research, and home to iconic financial market indicators, such as the S&P 500® and the Dow Jones Industrial Average®. More assets are invested in products based upon our indices than any other index provider in the world; with over 1,000,000 indices, S&P Dow Jones Indices defines the way people measure and trade the markets. We provide essential intelligence that helps investors identify and capitalize on global opportunities. S&P Dow Jones Indices is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spdji.com To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Quantitative Analyst/Data Scientist The Location: Boston, MA or Chicago, IL The Team: Our Quantamental Research group specializes in uncovering new anomalies and differentiated stock selection strategies. Integrated quantamental research products enable portfolio managers, quantitative analysts, and researchers to refine and differentiate their strategies to gain insights into new sources of potential alpha. Through their research, the group strives to combine the efficiency and breadth of the quantitative approach with the intuition, judgement and deep dive analysis of the fundamental approach. Areas of focus include: Event Driven Investing Industry-Specific Signals Supply Chain Interactions Insights from Academic Literature Alternative Data Sets Using the uniqueness and depth of S&P Global Market Intelligence's combined data and analytics offerings, the research group uncovers new investment insights in their monthly publications. Research findings are frequently cited by mainstream industry publications, including: The Wall Street Journal, Barron's, and Fortune, among others. The Impact: This role has both an internal research component and an externally facing component. The internal research role component consists of exploring and testing investment thesis and thoroughly documenting your results. The team’s research is often featured in top-tier media publications. The external aspect of this role involves communicating the actionable investment insights and solutions resulting from the research. The channels for communication are broad, including: industry events, webinars, and face to face meetings with institutional investment practitioners. You will spend a significant amount of time interacting with clients around investment solutions. What’s in it for you: This role is the opportunity to join our Quantamental Research team. This team of Global Equity Investment Researchers conducts innovative, industry leading investment research on which derived content is created. This research is the basis for in depth client interaction and the creation of derived content and analytics. Responsibilities: You will face interesting challenges and be counted on to creatively determine how best to get your job done. You will... Conduct hands-on, actionable innovative research around investment strategies using the entire suite of data and analytics at S&P Global. Collaborate with team members around a variety of research initiatives. All members of the research team drive their own research and support other team members on their initiatives. Publish industry leading research in white papers, blogs, research briefs. Present at sponsored and industry events and conduct webinars. Work closely with sales as a subject matter expert, providing proof statements to clients around research. Work with marketing around thematic research strategies. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications: Master’s degree in Statistics, Physical Sciences, Finance, or Technology required 3-5 years of relevant experience Preferred Qualifications: CFA (or working towards) Demonstrable knowledge of statistics and econometrics; as well as capital markets, particularly global equities Expertise in Machine Learning, NLP and have data science experience Able to establish credibility with clients and fellow team members around investment management ideas Real passion for asset management, capital markets and portfolio risk management Strong technical and programming skills in one or more high level programming languages such Clarifi, EXCEL, R, MatLab, SQL Organized and detail oriented. High degree of comfort with large datasets Deep analytical mindset and understanding of either a quantitative or fundamental investment approach Excellent presentation abilities Intellectual curiosity and inquisitiveness Ability to conduct investment research within a dynamic, team based culture Ability to explain complex investment concepts in simple terms About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. JobTitle: Associate, U.S. Public Finance - Transportation Infrastructure Group
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Associate, U.S. Public Finance – Transportation Infrastructure Group The Location: (Flexible) Chicago, IL / Dallas, TX / Centennial, CO / San Francisco, CA The Team: You will join a very collegial and professional team of analysts that are located, and that work on credits across the country. We are a national team looking for someone who can get up to speed quickly. Ratings analysts are a key part of the success of the department and make meaningful contributions every day. The Impact: You will be able to contribute to the team and company in a meaningful way. You will be integrated into a group with high expectations and can expect to have a notable impact. What’s in it for you: This position is a mid-level position, but with expectations for upward mobility. Advancement will be available to those who show a strong aptitude and embrace the municipal sector. While overall career development will depend on individual performance and company need, this is an opportunity for your skills and hard work to move you forward. Responsibilities: As an Associate, you will participate in the evaluation of the credit quality of governmental enterprises—specifically transportation—as it relates to their ability to repay debt obligations. You will be responsible for aggregating data and information to present to rating committees. You will interact with clients, make presentations, and prepare reports for internal and external distribution. This position will also include managing and processing large data sets. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications:• MBA, MPA, MPP or similar advanced degree preferred• BS, BA in finance, accounting, economics, government/public policy, or similar field required• Minimum 2+ years of relevant work experience required• A demonstrated interest in municipal enterprises and how they work • Strong work ethic and ability to work well both independently and as part a team • Strong ability to work with financial models and data, including cash flow and credit models • Strong communication skills and ability to interact confidently with clients • Strong computer skills, including MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint• Ability to learn in both formal training and on-the-job settings • Ability to thrive in a deadline-driven environment • Ability to be highly organized, detail-oriented, and juggle multiple priorities at once About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of merit, capability and equality of opportunity, and without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law, or any other characteristic that has no bearing on a person’s ability to perform his or her job. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description: The Enterprise Technology Architect will primarily be responsible to develop, evolve and maintain the enterprise technology architecture, technology products and standards in support of evolving business and technical strategies and objectives. Collaborate with Enterprise Architects, Solution, Data and Infrastructure Architects to develop enterprise technology policies, principles, standards, blueprints and patterns to be used across S&P Global. Will also serve as the technology champion for Enterprise Architecture working with the technical domain product engineering teams to ratify technical solutions at the Enterprise Architecture Council and refine/evolve the technology domain product roadmaps. Provide architectural guidance, governance on projects and maintain alignment between business strategies and business/technical architecture frameworks. An information technology professional with demonstrated architecture capabilities, a problem solver, and a strategic thinker; is adaptable to and drives change through thought leadership, education, communication, partnership and results. The Team: You will be an expert contributor and part of the Global Technology’s Cloud Services & Enterprise Architecture Team. This team, who has a broad and expert knowledge on many technology stacks and architectural patterns, fosters knowledge sharing and collaboration that results in a unified strategy. All architecture members provide leadership, innovation, timely delivery, and the ability to articulate business value. Be a part of a unique opportunity to build and evolve S&P’s Global Enterprise Architecture and Cloud Services strategy. Our Hiring Manager Says: If you are an individual who has the passion for driving change and implementing diverse aspects of technology architecture, this is an excellent opportunity. I am looking for someone with a strong technology architecture background, implemented or been part of an Enterprise Architecture program, strong leadership skills, thinks out of the box, brings in innovative ideas, and elevates our architecture from current state to target state. Responsibilities: Lead and facilitate the creation of governing principles and policies to guide EA decision-making. Analyze the current technology environment to detect critical deficiencies and work with Enterprise Architecture leads and the Enterprise Architecture Council to recommend solutions for improvement. Capture end-to-end current state and develop target state technology architecture and standards for the enterprise. Create architectural technology and business roadmaps that result in stronger business/IT alignment and drive adoption and usage of technology across the enterprise. Oversee and facilitate the evaluation and selection of new technology capabilities and product standards. Collaborate with technology domain product engineering to develop and communicate domain-wide policies, standards, guidelines and procedures and manage the technology portfolio and product lifecycle. Establish architecture governance processes that enable the evolution of enterprise technology, manage exceptions and non-conformance. Institute practices that guides the creation of application remediation plans to eradicate retired/obsolete/declining products. Provide leadership on initiatives on enterprise technologies and platforms such as portal, workflow, publishing, SOA, caching, cloud and analytics, mobile and others and ensure adherence to standard technologies. Establish compliance measures and reporting routines that monitors progress to drive business value. Your Skills: BS or MS degree in Computer Science or Information Technology. 10+ years of Information Technology experience. Expertise with of Enterprise Architecture processes, methods, and frameworks, including proficiency in business process modeling and redesign, requirements management, and research tools. Build architecture roadmaps, monitor industry trends and directions; develops and presents substantive technical recommendations to senior management. Experience with a wide variety technology domains – application technology domain (such as business process management, portals, integration platforms, API management...), security technology services (identity management, encryption, key management…), Infrastructure technology services (servers, OS, storage…), DevOps, Cloud CSPs (AWS, Azure…), and other leading edge technologies. Knowledge of Agile approaches to software development and able to put key Agile principles into practice to deliver solutions incrementally. Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with strong ability to influence both IT and business partners. Analytical thinking and problem solving skills with an ability to negotiate and trade-off technology options against goals and cost. Ability to handle multiple projects/efforts simultaneously and prioritize and manage work to critical project timelines in a fast-paced environment. About S&P Global At S&P Global, we don’t give you intelligence—we give you essential intelligence. The essential intelligence you need to make decisions with conviction. We’re the world’s foremost provider of ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include: S&P Global Ratings, which provides credit ratings, research and insights essential to driving growth and transparency. S&P Global Market Intelligence, which provides insights into companies, markets and data so that business and financial decisions can be made with conviction. S&P Dow Jones Indices, the world’s largest resource for iconic and innovative indices, which helps investors pinpoint global opportunities. S&P Global Platts, which equips customers to identify and seize opportunities in energy and commodities, stimulating business growth and market transparency. JobTitle: Associate Director, Solutions Delivery - Project/Program Manager
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description A Solutions Delivery Associate Director will monitor the product/program/project across various initiatives in the S&P Global Ratings division. They will design, develop and manage activities for solution delivery project initiatives which represent an incremental increase in value to the business but are in line with existing business processes and operations. This would include business case, solution definition and planning through build, test and deployment to production and end of life. Serves as the central resource with design, process, manufacturing, test and quality as an IT Solution moves to production, user adoption and value realization. A Solutions Delivery Associate Director will have above average skills matrix scores which they would look to develop to advance within the role, they will be advanced or expert in 25% of the core skills and be capable of coaching SD Analysts to improve their skills matrix scores in a quantifiable way. Key Roles & Responsibilities: Define project KPI's to track business value commitments defined during project initiation. Provide direction and guidance on reports and analyses and ensure recommendations are aligned with customer needs and capabilities. Utilize standard procedures and policies when selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results through IT solution delivery. Lead staff through the definition of IT solution that meets project targets measured by KPI's. Develop, define and execute project plans, schedules, budgets and deliverables. Review and analyse complex, integrated project data and information to provide status updates, insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations. Sign off on IT solutions to business problems. Including non-functional requirements. Act as the conduit and escalation between App Engineering and Business Stakeholders. Present documentation to process, controls and ratings governance committees. Functional and Business Knowledge: Operate as the conduit between business stakeholders and the various IT groups (App Dev, QA, Architecture) Project Management skills Think of the problem we are trying to solve, come up with a solution and identify the implementation timelines Process Map the current and future state process, get agreement with the stakeholders before building a solution Partner with key stakeholders to provide transparency into the project Own the business process and ensure enhancements, incidents are managed in a proactive and timeline manner Experience with CRA3, Dodd Frank regulations and working with regulatory bodies like ESMA, SEC is preferred Typical Scope & Impact Contribute to the achievement of Project Management and IT objectives. Work on issues where analysis of situation or data requires review of relevant factors. Minimum and Preferred Education Bachelor's degree; Master's preferred Minimum and Preferred Experience/Skills 8+ years of related experience, including some managerial experience Experience with CRA3 regulations and working with regulatory bodies like ESMA, SEC preferred. Experience with Agile delivery is also preferred About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. JobTitle: Lead II, Information Security - Governance & Policy
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Role: This role will be responsible for creating, maintaining, implementing and enforcing policies, standards and procedures that support the Information Security organization. The analyst will function as an integral member of the Information Security team and collaborate with various security, business, audit and IT teams in order to develop and execute a comprehensive Information Security Policies & Governance Program. The lead will ensure that security policies, standards, guidelines, communication programs provide comprehensive, coherent, implementable and repeatable processes. Further, the analyst will assist in maintaining and evolving the necessary governance bodies to support Information Security working with the various S&P Global divisions. The lead will provide risk assessments and monitor risk tolerance and appetite. Finally, the lead will assist in regulatory responses, resulting management action plans and requisite follow-up. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for the creation and maintenance of Information Security policies, standards, guidelines and procedures. Translate standard frameworks, recommendations from subject matter experts, and industry best practices into high-quality, coherent and implementable policies, standards and procedures. Harmonize content of new and updated artifacts with other enterprise policies and standards and security frameworks. Work closely with the divisions to effectively implement them. Responsible for effectively communicating & highlighting content and roadmaps intended for varied audiences. Collaborate with the Information Security and Risk Management teams on policy and governance related issues and concerns in order to develop update and measure effectiveness of policies, standards and procedures. Create and maintain mechanisms for enforcing policies, procedures, etc. Ensure procedures and processes are relevant. Aid in integration with existing and new business processes. Collaborate with the Information Security team to integrate policies and standards related content into training & awareness programs. Establish the appropriate metrics and reporting to measure program effectiveness. Assist in formulating & enacting the necessary governance entities to support Information Security working with S&P Global divisions & Risk Management. Assist in formulating the risk framework for the group. Perform information security risk assessments, maintain the information security risk register, and assist in formulating risk tolerance and risk appetite in collaboration with the Chief Risk Officer’s office. Assist with regulatory responses, resulting management action plans and requisite follow-up. Support other Information Security processes and projects as necessary. Qualifications BS or MS - preferably in Computer Science with a concentration in Information Security. Security and risk management certification (e.g. CRISC, CGEIT, CISSP, CISM, CRMA, CISO Certification – from an accredited institution) 5+ years working with IT risk and/or security; prior information security and risk management experience in a financial services company. Experience working in information security and demonstrable understanding of the concepts of information security. Experience with information security risk assessments and audit. Knowledgeable with Information Security laws and regulations. Knowledgeable with Information Security control frameworks and standards. Experience with NIST 800-53 Rev. 4; ISO 27001/2/5 and OWASP are a plus. Experience working with various financial regulatory entities (SEC, ESMA, FSA, MAS, et al) – a plus. Excellent communication skills. Ability to communicate with various levels of the organization including technical as well as non-technical audiences. Great customer service and relationship management skills. Skilled in executive level presentations and briefings. Experience managing communication to internal customers. Demonstrated ability to think creatively while accounting for multiple perspectives in any given scenario. Flexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid change. Must be able to work independently and with minimal direct supervision. Focused on how to best convey procedures and information clearly and concisely. Project Management experience is a plus. Excellent time management, organizational, and decision-making skills. Good judgment, tact, and decision-making ability. About S&P Global At S&P Global, we don’t give you intelligence—we give you essential intelligence. The essential intelligence you need to make decisions with conviction. We’re the world’s foremost provider of ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include: S&P Global Ratings, which provides credit ratings, research and insights essential to driving growth and transparency. S&P Global Market Intelligence, which provides insights into companies, markets and data so that business and financial decisions can be made with conviction. S&P Dow Jones Indices, the world’s largest resource for iconic and innovative indices, which helps investors pinpoint global opportunities. S&P Global Platts, which equips customers to identify and seize opportunities in energy and commodities, stimulating business growth and market transparency. JobTitle: Director, US Public Finance, Lead Analyst
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description S&P Global is the world's foremost provider of financial market intelligence, including independent credit ratings, indices, risk evaluation, investment research and data. With roughly 20,000 employees, including wholly owned affiliates, located in 21 countries, S&P Global is an essential part of the world's financial infrastructure and has played a leading role for more than 150 years in providing investors with the independent benchmarks they need to feel more confident about their investment and financial decisions. The Team / The Business The local government team has a strong collegial environment and friendly atmosphere; as a new analyst, you would be regularly assigned to work with senior analysts to improve your knowledge and understanding, and we would expect you to frequently ask questions of senior analysts, who are happy to oblige. A lot of the work is completed independently, but every rating involves a team of analysts, so teamwork is very important. The pace is fairly rapid, so if the thought of working on one report by yourself for months sounds boring to you, you’d like this environment. Key Responsibilities: As a Director, you will analyze a portfolio of assigned entities as well as complex situations, data, and information, assess client’s financial projections and resolve difficult deal-specific analytical situations. This position is responsible for meeting with issuers and investors on analytical matters, assisting in resolving client needs, contributing to media requirements in conjunction with other senior members of the organization, and taking the lead at external meetings related to credits. In addition, as a Team Lead, you will support your team by taking on responsibilities delegated to you from the Analytical Manager. Specifically, in this role, the analyst will: Rate complex deals, and proficiently write complex analytical reports. Serve to establish policy, lead criteria, policy, and analytical deliberations, identify and develop needed changes/innovations in rating methodology/criteria standards and the ratings process, and ensure that analytical guidelines, quality standards, procedures and policies established are adhered to for all credits. Act as a senior member of rating committees and be responsible for convening and conducting of rating committee deliberations in area of expertise. May act as the rating committee chair and assure the integrity of the rating process. Act as an active, vocal voting member of the committee. Function as a sector expert on credits. Publish timely industry commentaries, and proficiently write sector reviews and thought leadership pieces. Develop and lead ideas on papers across a broad range of issues for publication in S&P journals and other publications. Speaking publically and representing the company to external stakeholders. Lead a “pod” of analysts as Team Lead and coordinate with your Analytical Manager to support your team in the areas of coaching, influencing, process and efficiency improvements. The person in this position will have the opportunity to increase our ability to efficiently and effectively serve our clients. Your analysis and work is essential to the covering of a diverse portfolio of credits, as well as in the training of others to help them resolve difficult day-to-day analytical issues and problems. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree is required, Master’s degree a plus. 7+ years of experience related to Public Finance or financial services is highly preferred. Be equipped to ensure that analytical guidelines, quality standards, procedures and policies established are adhered to for all credits. Strong analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills. The candidate should have the aptitude to be a team player, but also be able to work independently. Demonstrated ability to coach and mentor analytical team members. Strong communication (oral and written), interpersonal and organizational management skills. Position Location: Centennial, New York, Dallas, Chicago, San Francisco About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. JobTitle: Associate, U.S. Public Finance - Transportation Infrastructure Group
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Associate, U.S. Public Finance – Transportation Infrastructure Group The Location: (Flexible) Chicago, IL / Dallas, TX / Centennial, CO / San Francisco, CA The Team: You will join a very collegial and professional team of analysts that are located, and that work on credits across the country. We are a national team looking for someone who can get up to speed quickly. Ratings analysts are a key part of the success of the department and make meaningful contributions every day. The Impact: You will be able to contribute to the team and company in a meaningful way. You will be integrated into a group with high expectations and can expect to have a notable impact. What’s in it for you: This position is a mid-level position, but with expectations for upward mobility. Advancement will be available to those who show a strong aptitude and embrace the municipal sector. While overall career development will depend on individual performance and company need, this is an opportunity for your skills and hard work to move you forward. Responsibilities: As an Associate, you will participate in the evaluation of the credit quality of governmental enterprises—specifically transportation—as it relates to their ability to repay debt obligations. You will be responsible for aggregating data and information to present to rating committees. You will interact with clients, make presentations, and prepare reports for internal and external distribution. This position will also include managing and processing large data sets. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications:• MBA, MPA, MPP or similar advanced degree preferred• BS, BA in finance, accounting, economics, government/public policy, or similar field required• Minimum 2+ years of relevant work experience required• A demonstrated interest in municipal enterprises and how they work • Strong work ethic and ability to work well both independently and as part a team • Strong ability to work with financial models and data, including cash flow and credit models • Strong communication skills and ability to interact confidently with clients • Strong computer skills, including MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint• Ability to learn in both formal training and on-the-job settings • Ability to thrive in a deadline-driven environment • Ability to be highly organized, detail-oriented, and juggle multiple priorities at once About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: We are a premier sector-focused news and financial information provider, is looking fora Lead Project Manager with a strong Salesforce background to join our Information Platforms team in our office located in Charlottesville or Richmond, VA. The Impact: You will work alongside Salesforce Solutions Architect and other Salesforce team members. You will use your Salesforce Platform skills experience to help improve our Salesforce Platform. You will be involved in strategic that will enhance the platform including working in all areas of Salesforce, from Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, App Partners, Lightning, Wave and more. The Career Opportunity: Would you like the opportunity to work on a team that will craft the future of the S&P Global Market Intelligence Salesforce Instance? Do you love being part of a team committed to delivering excellence? This position will enable you to interact with a agile team of in house Salesforce professionals from around the world. You will also have been instrumental in implementing Salesforce best practices and utilize your technical project management skills to lead projects from conception to completion in an Agile environment across one or multiple CRM teams. The Team / The Business: Our team is responsible for the management and improvements of the Business Applications that drive the S&P Global Market Intelligence Division. The team leads many internal applications from Salesforce, Order to Cash, Order Fulfillment, Reporting and Workflow tools. You will have the opportunity every single day to work with people from a wide variety of backgrounds and are able to develop a close team dynamic with coworkers from around the globe. Job Responsibilities: Lead design discussions and work with technical teams to implement new features and continuausly improve the platform Lead projects for Salesforce.com implementations or customizations Work with CRM professionals and partners to build customized solutions that support the business requirements Identify ways to better utilize Salesforce for business process, make recommendations on improvements Support change management process for new improvements into production Manage projects from an Agile perspective end to end Experience and proficiency with a variety of items including: 6+ Years as a Salesforce Professional Salesforce Certifications required Technical background in Computer Science or Software Engineering Able to analyze requirements, resolve, document and communicate the optimal design approach Excellent partner management skills Experience working in an Agile/Scrum Organization About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit, S&P Global Market Intelligence To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description At S&P Dow Jones Indices, our role can be described in one word: essential. We’re the largest global resource for index-based concepts, data and research, and home to iconic financial market indicators, such as the S&P 500® and the Dow Jones Industrial Average®. More assets are invested in products based upon our indices than any other index provider in the world; with over 1,000,000 indices, S&P Dow Jones Indices defines the way people measure and trade the markets. We provide essential intelligence that helps investors identify and capitalize on global opportunities. S&P Dow Jones Indices is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spdji.com The Role: Director Innovation and Strategy The Impact: This is an high-impact role in Innovation and Strategy Group of S&P Dow Jones Indices (“S&P DJI”) focusing on fintech opportunities and index product innovation. Individual will support strategic initiatives and analyses from the Innovation and Strategy Team. The Opportunity: This Role will give applicant high profile exposure to innovative fintech startups as well as present opportunities to apply analytic, project, and influence anagement disciplines to new index product development. This role also affords to chance to learn the Index business, one of the fastest growing segments of financial services. The Team/The Business: The index business is a fast growing, high margin intellectual property licensing and data business catering to asset managers, banks, exchanges, and investors globally. A small, dynamic team affords multiple roles and exposure to a wide variety of projects and business cases. Responsibilities: (include but are not limited to) Establish an ongoing and systematic process to monitor and assess strategic opportunities/risks outside S&P DJI’s traditional business environment and organization. Identify and monitor key fintech trends impacting the index market ecosystem. Assist in analysis, development, and launch of fintech-related and other innovative, non-traditional indices Produce in-depth analysis on specific fintech firms as warranted Work with selected fintech companies to implement capabilities into S&P DJI’s business Work on potential transactions (joint ventures, equity investments, partnerships, and M&A) with selected fintech and index-related companies Preferred Qualifications: Strong writing, conceptualization, and analytic skills Strong interpersonal skills Ability to work with numerous external and internal constituencies Ability to work independently Qualifications : MBA or equivalent 5 years of financial services experience – asset management, portfolio analysis, consulting Financial data, benchmarking, or index experience a plus 2 years+ of fintech experience (start-up, incubators/accelerators, VC, PE, corporate, consulting) S&P Global includes Standard & Poor’s Ratings Services, S&P Global Market and Commodities Intelligence, and S&P Dow Jones Indices. Together, we’re the foremost providers of essential intelligence for the capital and commodities markets. Additional information is available at www.spglobal.com/careers S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of merit, capability and equality of opportunity, and without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law, or any other characteristic that has no bearing on a person’s ability to perform his or her job. Apply Now JobDescription : The Role: As a HADOOP Administrator you will Support, Administer, Manage, and Tune the sub-Terra byte Data Systems that will enable S&P Global Market Intelligence to ingest, manage, process and serve-up Market Data Products (Global Risk Solutions, Pricing, Ratings & Financial Aggregates) as well as our highly transactional and dynamic web based CIQ Platform & Credit Solutions Portal. You will lead large-scale Hadoop cluster environments, handling all Hadoop environment builds, including design, cluster setup, performance tuning, ongoing monitoring and capacity planning. Do you love working every single day collaborating with the global team in ensuring reliability and supportability of the HDFS Clusters and other Open Source Software such as SOLR/Cassandra? Are you passionate about leading key database releases for QA, Alpha, Production and DR as part of the overall SDLC? In this role you will maintain the Software by patch applications and enhancements/upgrades of environments. Automate routine maintenance tasks using standard scripting practices Work with other teams with in operations and peer groups like Development and QA. Work with IT Service Management and other groups and make sure that all events, incidents and problems are resolved as per the SLA. Contribute to best of breed product support tools including run books, monitoring, and knowledge bases to aid in the product support process. Suggest improvements to current processes and tools we use and also suggest implementation ideas. The Scope & Impact: Our Platform products rely on data to allow our customers to find the companies, securities and markets they are passionate about, to explore the relationships between entities, and to search using public identifiers (CUSIPs, ISINs, SEDOLs, Tickers, etc). This critical backend driven data allow our users to value their portfolios, monitor market moving events, understand their risk and maintain their back office systems. Contribute to the achievement of Hadoop Administration objectives Work on issues where analysis of situation or data requires review of relevant factors. The Career Opportunity: This is the place to hone your existing HDFS and leadership skills while having the chance to become exposed to divergent technologies (Oracle in RAC environments, Golden Gate Replication, Exadata, Dataguard, ZDS Appliances, WebLogic, Sonic JMS, MySQL, Informatica, MS SQL Server Product Family, NoSQL, SOLR, Vertica, Cassandra, active-active Databases, and petabyte storage levels). As a critical member of the team, you will have the opportunity collaborate with a global team of database administrators and engineers who have recently graduated as well as other team members who are authorities in their domain. Handle Production Database Support rotation on a need basis in weekends. The Team / The Business: You will be part of a premier IT Services and Operations team supporting various product offerings of S&P Global Market Intelligence powered by various middle tier, database and OS technologies and used by tens of thousands of users globally. The team is responsible for ensuring Greater Reliability, High Performance, High Availability and Scalability. You will work with a group of intelligent and visionary professionals recruited from top industries. You and your team will provide the database support, administration, scalability, performance tuning, release and architecture of large-scale data processing, aggregation and retrieval systems. Your Skills: Good hands on experience in Linux Environments Extensive Experience with HDFS (Hortonworks is preferred) and its associated technologies like Spark, HIVE, Yarn, Kafka is required. Experience with additional open Source tools like SOLR, Cassandra, Vertica and PostgreSQL is a huge advantage Good experience with Operations, administration, performance tuning, and database monitoring. Good knowledge on Shell Programming, Python, Perl Scripting, JSON or any other scripting or program language is a requirement. Superb communication skills, with strong verbal and writing proficiencies. Ability to solve problems involving Client Libraries (like JDBC), Web Logic, Operating Systems, Network and Storage is preferred. Additional Note / Our Hiring Manager says: We are looking for the kind of person who is not only a roll up the sleeves devoted Hadoop Administrator, but also a passionate team member who can lead by example and motivate their peers to excel. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Engineering 3+ years of hands-on database administration, support and performance tuning experience Experience in a start-up or Agile or Dev Ops environment is a plus. ITIL V3 Foundation Certified - preferred About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit, S&P Global Market Intelligence To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Are you interested in Cloud, automation, and integration? We want to provide Cloud as a service. And we need talent for a key IT initiative to migrate all applications and data to public Cloud. We want to create a pipeline where everything in the Cloud is automated, secure, and immutable. Responsibilities Enable application migration to public and private Cloud Become subject matter expert in application integration for Cloud, on-prem and hybrid environments Provide integration support of Cloud applications Develop automation to enable Dev, QA and Operations teams to work seamlessly in the Cloud Provide new service offerings through application integration and education Manage and maintain cloud inventory and costs Desired Expertise Expert level: AWS, configuration management tools (ansible, salt, chef, puppet), common Cloud migration techniques, Cloud native application design patterns, Cloud operations tools and processes such as infrastructure provisioning, application monitoring, governance, and financial optimization Proficient with: common DevOps tools such as Git, Jenkins, and Jira Nice to have: knowledge of Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM SoftLayer, or Rackspace, ServiceNow, ITIL, Docker containers DevOps Experience Experience with installation, configuration and management of common DevOps tools like Git, Jenkins, Artifactory, and Ansible or similar configuration management languages Experience working in agile and collaborative DevOps teams Experience building and migrating applications to DevOps process Desired Experience 5 to 10 years of industry experiences, with 2+ years working in public cloud environments Experience working with/for shared service providers with 2+ years creating solutions Experience working in enterprise (large scale, high complexity) IT organizations Experience building cloud-native applications Experience migrating application from traditional datacenters to public cloud Experience migrating applications from dedicated hardware to virtualized stack such as VMWare Experience in an operational Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Quantitative Analyst/Data Scientist The Location: Boston, MA or Chicago, IL The Team: Our Quantamental Research group specializes in uncovering new anomalies and differentiated stock selection strategies. Integrated quantamental research products enable portfolio managers, quantitative analysts, and researchers to refine and differentiate their strategies to gain insights into new sources of potential alpha. Through their research, the group strives to combine the efficiency and breadth of the quantitative approach with the intuition, judgement and deep dive analysis of the fundamental approach. Areas of focus include: Event Driven Investing Industry-Specific Signals Supply Chain Interactions Insights from Academic Literature Alternative Data Sets Using the uniqueness and depth of S&P Global Market Intelligence's combined data and analytics offerings, the research group uncovers new investment insights in their monthly publications. Research findings are frequently cited by mainstream industry publications, including: The Wall Street Journal, Barron's, and Fortune, among others. The Impact: This role has both an internal research component and an externally facing component. The internal research role component consists of exploring and testing investment thesis and thoroughly documenting your results. The team’s research is often featured in top-tier media publications. The external aspect of this role involves communicating the actionable investment insights and solutions resulting from the research. The channels for communication are broad, including: industry events, webinars, and face to face meetings with institutional investment practitioners. You will spend a significant amount of time interacting with clients around investment solutions. What’s in it for you: This role is the opportunity to join our Quantamental Research team. This team of Global Equity Investment Researchers conducts innovative, industry leading investment research on which derived content is created. This research is the basis for in depth client interaction and the creation of derived content and analytics. Responsibilities: You will face interesting challenges and be counted on to creatively determine how best to get your job done. You will... Conduct hands-on, actionable innovative research around investment strategies using the entire suite of data and analytics at S&P Global. Collaborate with team members around a variety of research initiatives. All members of the research team drive their own research and support other team members on their initiatives. Publish industry leading research in white papers, blogs, research briefs. Present at sponsored and industry events and conduct webinars. Work closely with sales as a subject matter expert, providing proof statements to clients around research. Work with marketing around thematic research strategies. What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications: Master’s degree in Statistics, Physical Sciences, Finance, or Technology required 3-5 years of relevant experience Preferred Qualifications: CFA (or working towards) Demonstrable knowledge of statistics and econometrics; as well as capital markets, particularly global equities Expertise in Machine Learning, NLP and have data science experience Able to establish credibility with clients and fellow team members around investment management ideas Real passion for asset management, capital markets and portfolio risk management Strong technical and programming skills in one or more high level programming languages such Clarifi, EXCEL, R, MatLab, SQL Organized and detail oriented. High degree of comfort with large datasets Deep analytical mindset and understanding of either a quantitative or fundamental investment approach Excellent presentation abilities Intellectual curiosity and inquisitiveness Ability to conduct investment research within a dynamic, team based culture Ability to explain complex investment concepts in simple terms About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction.
