Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Impact: High-impact role in the Information & Technology, Solution Delivery group of S&P Ratings focusing on delivering strategic projects & initiatives on time, on scope and on budget. A Solutions Delivery Analyst will assist in the development of project plans, schedules, budgets and deliverables. They will be able to contribute to the design, development and management activities for a solution delivery project including business case, solution definition and planning through build, test and deployment to production and end of life. This individual will serve as the central resource with design, process, manufacturing, test and quality as an IT Solution moves to production, user adoption and value realization. The Opportunity (what’s in it for you): As a member of a dynamic team your contributions directly impact the quality of services provided by self or others in related teams. This role offers exposure to a wide variety of projects and business cases over the course of your career. The Team/The Business: Solutions Delivery is a results driven, fast paced, high performing service provider of project management, business analysis and user experience expertise. We service the S&P Global Ratings organization by delivering end to end solutions for strategic IT projects with excellence. Responsibilities: Develop, define and execute project plans, schedules, budgets and deliverables. Review and analyze complex, integrated project data and information to provide status updates, insights, conclusions and actionable recommendations. Documentation of IT solutions to business problems. Including non-functional requirements. Work with S&P Global Ratings solution delivery team and analytics leadership team to help execute our digital strategy, focusing on how digital capabilities can be used to enhance analytical tools Develop and maintain consultative relationships with outside vendors to proactively identify and address business needs Design and perform pilot projects to address and improve analytics with AI and ML Work with product engineers to translate POCs into new services and features and provide guideline for large-scale implementation Support and execute on the implementation of business solutions Partner with Project Simplify team to develop technology roadmaps that deliver value incrementally towards long term visions and objectives Demonstrate up-to date expertise in S&P Global Ratings systems and operational data analysis and apply this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans Model compliance with company policies and procedures; support company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity Basic Qualifications- Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent 5 Years in Industry: Financial Services (3 yrs with Master’s Degree or PhD) 3 Years in a Specialty/Discipline Preferred Qualifications – Uses judgment based on practice and precedence and accurately defines problems by trying to understand underlying factors/causes. Demonstrated on the job experience proposing, implementing, and evaluating AI and ML techniques for the ratings process Strong writing, conceptualization, and analytic skills Strong interpersonal skills – Well developed communication and diplomacy skills to exchange complex information Ability to form questions and hypothesis about long-term strategy of business and follow through with business strategy Ability to work independently - Manages own work with limited supervision. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Are you ready to start your career in research? Do you want to develop a deep understanding of financial markets? As an assistant analyst, you will support the Leveraged Commentary & Data Group (LCD) by collecting and analyzing information and maintaining the proprietary database. The Location: New York, NY The Team: We are a team of nearly 30 analysts and reporters who work every single day to combine real-time news and trend analysis on U.S. and European leveraged loan, high-yield bond, distressed debt and corporate markets. Do you crave feedback? Are you passionate about quality? If so, you will love our dynamic team environment, partnering closely with mentors to continually improve data quality and the timely publication of data. The Impact: Our trend analysis, research and reports contextualize the current market against 20 years of historical data. Your work relates to data providers in the marketplace, information input into the index, and outpost reports provided back to our clients. What's in it for you: Develop your analytical skills and research abilities. Explore a highly-rewarding career path with room for professional growth, recognition and rewards. Learn from industry-leading analysts and experts. Responsibilities: Build and update leveraged loan and high yield bond profiles based upon bank books and prospectuses gathered from the market. Aggregate information from market sources. Support the production lifecycle for research reports and analysis. Partner with senior analysts and other group members on data collection processes and analysis projects. Build a deep knowledge of leveraged finance markets. This includes the mechanics of the markets, syndication processes and documentation. What We're Looking For: Basic Qualifications: Bachelors’ degree in business or related discipline Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices Strong attention to detail and a keen eye for accuracy. Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and Power Point. Preferred Qualifications: Prior experience in finance or accounting Experience with research and analysis of financial statements or market data Knowledge of MS Access or relational databases About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. JobTitle: Director of Salesforce Operational Strategy (S&P Global Platts)
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: The Director, Salesforce Operational Strategy, will lead all aspects of operations and platform effectiveness from the Platts business perspective of the Salesforce.com Platform and mobile applications. Ensure delivery of innovative, high quality solutions that enable Platts cross functional Operations to accomplish business objectives. This requires the ability to understand development workflow and support applications using Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Communities, SF Mobile, Lightening and the Force.com platform. Responsibilities include translating business needs into functional requirements with detailed technical design specifications, conduct research, technical analysis, design, development, testing and implementation for Salesforce projects and enhancements based on industry best practices. Manage platform operations to facilitate continuous improvement of the Salesforce.com environment. This role will be responsible for developing operational efficiencies through technical solutions addressed by Business Stakeholders that will impact Franchise Operational Excellence. Reporting to the Global Head of Customer Excellence, the successful candidate will have a robust understanding of the Salesforce.com platform with strong people leadership skills as well as project management experience. In addition, has solid knowledge, skills and experience with SFDC standard out of the box functionality and creating innovative custom applications on the Force.com platform. This includes experience with using Apex and Visual force in an Agile environment. The Location: Hightstown, NJ Responsibilities: Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in the development of Custom Applications on the Salesforce.com Platform and integration with Enterprise Systems. Provide project requirements, technical design, integration architecture, solution recommendations, ROM estimates and detailed requirements. Govern change management process from backlog to production across the development lifecycle. Ensure that all necessary changes are documented, reviewed, tested, approved, deployed and communicated to stakeholders. Provide technical insight to Platts for Salesforce.com and integration with various Systems (Zuora, SpringCM, Xactly, Qlik, Office 365, ShowPad, Eloqua/Marketo, Survey tool, Web Chat and Telephony systems) Remain current on new Salesforce features and functionality and provide recommendations for process improvement. Develop a vision for the future state of that landscape Manage stakeholders and serve as principle point of contact for Senior/Executive leadership Be the principle interface between Commercial teams and corporate IT as well as with contacts at Salesforce.com Additional Responsibilities: Direct and supervise the SFDC Product owner and CRM administrators Develop a keen and comprehensive understanding of the current CRM landscape Managing the creation of training materials for cross departmental business use Required Skills: Detailed knowledge of Salesforce.com Sales, Service and Marketing Clouds, Communities, SF1 and Lightening Experience in designing and executing against a long-term Salesforce.com strategy required Experience with APEX, Visual Force Experience with Salesforce Integration concepts using Soap or Rest API Web Services to various IT Systems (Salesforce to Salesforce, Adobe, Oracle, SharePoint) Experience managing relationship Technical staff Understanding of SQL, SOQL and SOSL queries Strong understanding of Relational Databases and ETL integration (My SQL, Oracle, Informatica, Salesforce Connector) Experience using Salesforce.com data tools (Data Loader, Excel Connector, CRM Fusion) Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills A strong focus and a capacity to collaborate with partners to troubleshoot and optimize processes Ability to analyze and creatively solve complex business and technical problems Strong MS Office skills, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio Ability to lead and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously Required Experience/Certificates/Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or Related Field Salesforce Certifications: Salesforce Certified Platform Developer, Application Developer (DEV-401/501), Advanced Salesforce Administrator (ADM-211); Sales Cloud Consultant (ADM-251) 5+ years Salesforce Platform experience About S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.platts.com To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: We are a premier sector-focused news and financial information provider, is looking fora Lead Project Manager with a strong Salesforce background to join our Information Platforms team in our office located in Charlottesville or Richmond, VA. The Impact: You will work alongside Salesforce Solutions Architect and other Salesforce team members. You will use your Salesforce Platform skills experience to help improve our Salesforce Platform. You will be involved in strategic that will enhance the platform including working in all areas of Salesforce, from Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, App Partners, Lightning, Wave and more. The Career Opportunity: Would you like the opportunity to work on a team that will craft the future of the S&P Global Market Intelligence Salesforce Instance? Do you love being part of a team committed to delivering excellence? This position will enable you to interact with a agile team of in house Salesforce professionals from around the world. You will also have been instrumental in implementing Salesforce best practices and utilize your technical project management skills to lead projects from conception to completion in an Agile environment across one or multiple CRM teams. The Team / The Business: Our team is responsible for the management and improvements of the Business Applications that drive the S&P Global Market Intelligence Division. The team leads many internal applications from Salesforce, Order to Cash, Order Fulfillment, Reporting and Workflow tools. You will have the opportunity every single day to work with people from a wide variety of backgrounds and are able to develop a close team dynamic with coworkers from around the globe. JobTitle: Paralegal & Contracts Operation Specialist - S&P Global Platts - New York
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Paralegal & Contracts Operation Specialist – S&P Global Platts – London or New York Role Purpose: The successful candidate will perform various Paralegal tasks and be responsible for the management and operation of the Platts contract management system and other technical and centralized applications that support Platts globally. In addition to contract management and administration, this position will assist the Platts legal team with paralegal functions such as trademark administration, due diligence on corporate transactions, corporate entity and tax support, document discovery and various other tasks. The Impact: Manage contract administration and database, and other technical and centralized applications that support the Platts legal team on a global basis, including by interacting with the Platts technology team and external vendors to ensure ongoing functionality of such technology and implementation of updates. Responsible for administering a variety of contracts including service agreements, customer contracts, vendor contracts, software licenses, NDAs, amendments, order forms and related documents. Manage new requests submitted for legal support with such agreements in the contract management database. Ensure timely and accurate recording of routed agreements into contract management system and that all executed agreements are entered into the contract database in a timely and accurate fashion. Work with the Platts legal team Platts sales and business management (including sales administration, product managers) to incorporate new processes and procedures into the contract process in an effort to integrate improvement/efficiencies in the contract process through new technology, etc. The Career Opportunity: Ensure integrity and accuracy of the information in the database. Conduct periodic reviews to confirm integrity and accuracy of information in the database and provide recommendations on continued improvements to the application. Ensure that all information obtained by the Platts legal team is entered into the Applications on an accurate and timely basis (including, among other things, terminations and assignments). Assist with trademark administration for the Platts business, including working with colleagues on the SPGI legal team and outside counsel to manage trademark administration. Assist with due diligence in corporate transactions and integration tasks for acquisitions. Assist the Platts legal team and colleagues in the corporate functions with corporate secretarial/entity and tax-related work. Assist inside and outside counsel with document discovery in various legal matters as they arise. The Team/Business: S&P Global (NYSE:S&P Global) is an operational company providing financial and industry data, research, news and analytics to investment professionals, government agencies, corporations, and universities worldwide. S&P Global Platts is the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to Platts expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. Platts is headquartered in London and employs over 1,000 people in more than 15 offices worldwide. Qualification: Bachelor Degree or the equivalent legal qualifications Previous working experience in a Paralegal position within a corporate environment Legal, Licensing & Market Data exposure is essential Knowledge of contract databases and other information management tools. Spring CM is highly sought after Proven management skills and the ability to develop employees The ability to draft documentation and be able to present and articulate About S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Platts Analytics Account Executive - Midmarkets The Location: Denver, CO The Team: This is an opportunity to join a dynamic sales team within Platts that focuses on expanding our energy analytics business. Our portfolio of products is constantly evolving, so we are looking for someone who can learn new markets and products quickly. This is a fast-paced and progressive team, and we are looking for a self-driven individual who can be successful in growing our energy business in the U.S. Southern region. The Impact: The Account Executive is responsible for finding new client accounts and growing and nurturing existing customers within a North American territory through. The individual will be collaborating with Platts Business Development Managers in a subject matter expert capacity. This role will also be responsible for providing product feedback to the Bentek analytical team. What’s in it for you: Opportunity to be a part of one of the largest energy analytics providers in North America. Exposure to Top Energy Producers, Investment Banks, Midstream Companies, and Fortune 500 companies Opportunity to work with top energy market experts and analysts Accessibility to gain a deeper market understanding for Global oil, gas, and NGLs. Responsibilities: Meets and exceeds revenue quotas. Extensive Customer facing activity including prospecting new clients, ongoing development of existing accounts and driving new product sales. Understand in depth set territory, customer accounts and bank of business; develop and implement comprehensive customer centric account strategy and territory plan. Develop and build meaningful relationships with key and influential contacts; Collaborate with other sales and sales support functions to help ensure service levels and value-add needs are met Manage renewals and strengthen relationships within existing accounts. Service customers and prospects with quotes, demos and sample products. Prospecting new business and manage incoming leads. Maintain a high lead to sales close conversion rate. Maintain Salesforce activity log; Provide monthly reports to management; Produce an accurate monthly forecast; Build strong profiles for top 10 clients. What We’re Looking For:Basic Qualifications: Minimum 3+ years’ experience in a B2B sales corporate environment Excellent organization and communication skills both written and verbal; Must utilize strong phone, interpersonal and sales prospecting skills. Adds value to the customer relationship by distilling, summarizing, interpreting and communicating information to facilitate its usefulness. Strong time management, multi-tasking and organization skills. Strong business and professional acumen. Superior customer relationship management skills. Consultative/Solution sales and strong negotiation skills Highly proficient in excel (pivot tables and charts) and using CRM systems Ability to travel up to 40% Strong analytical skills Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree 5+ years’ experience in downstream oil, gas, or power industry 2+ years’ experience in energy commodity analytics About S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Research and analyze trading activity to derive price assessments in physical natural gas or power markets. Engage with market participants to increase market knowledge, develop relationships, and expand Platts’ benchmark assessments. The Location: Houston, Texas The Team: The team works closely together, not only in terms of market coverage and responsibilities, but also in sharing of market information. It is a very team oriented culture where everyone looks out for one another. The Impact: Platts price assessments are viewed as essential information by market participants to make informed trading decisions. This candidate is expected to enhance Platts position as a thought leader in the industry through creating actionable content via market commentaries and stories, and engaging with customers through various media outlets (videos, podcasts, conferences, meetings). What's in it for you: The candidate has a tremendous opportunity to grow personally and professionally in this role. They will cover a market on a daily basis, allowing them to build a network of contacts, learn about market dynamics, and gain a greater understanding of commodity price movements. Platts is unique in that it provides for growth not only within a commodity, but also amongst other commodities within Content, or even other groups at Platts all around the world. Responsibilities: Assess daily and weekly prices for import/export and domestic markets Gather commodity price information, meet compliance standards, produce price assessments, and write , analyses. Assess the value of prices fully in line with S&P Global Platts’ rigorous published methodologies Maintain high quality, timely and real-time feed of news and pricing Work closely with news desk, managers and others to identify news stories on market issues Develop, expand and maintain sources/contacts relevant to the area of coverage Effectively manage and develop price reporting coverage in the region What We're Looking For: We are looking for the kind of person who is intellectually curious, interested in energy markets, and has a desire to learn about the constantly changing dynamics on a national and global scale. If you are right for this role, you will provide actionable intelligence to our customers and be thought of as a market leader in your commodity of coverage. You’ll love this job because you will be constantly learning about ever evolving markets and will have many opportunities to challenge yourself in a market leading company with global reach Basic Qualifications: Basic Microsoft Excel and Word Communication skills (verbal and written) Hard worker Organized and able to meet deadlinesExhibits a natural curiosity for the energy industry. Demonstrates a willingness to continually learn and develop. Track record for delivering against demanding targets and deliverables. Comfortable with high levels of accountability. Ability to provide insightful analysis to the market in compelling and straightforward content adding value to the product About S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.platts.com To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description Governance and Controls Administrator – IT Operations S&P Global Ratings is seeking a Governance and Controls Administrator to monitor and mature Operational controls within the organization. This position will ensure that Operational controls meet regulatory and audit requirements as well as align to industry best practices including IT SOX. The candidate will be working closely with IT counter parts to monitor that controls meet defined and documented requirements. The position will also be responsible for enhancing and further automating monitoring process to allow for broader coverage across the Ratings IT portfolio of applications. The individual will report to the Director of IT Operations who leads the Governance function. The IT Operations Governance team includes global coverage of the Change Management function as well as enabling our Controls Monitoring function for regular review and reports of operating controls around our applications and infrastructure. The candidate will need to work collaboratively across the organization and must be able to follow-up on open items, develop meeting agendas and produce project plans and metrics to move initiatives forward. In addition, the candidate must be able to manage multiple project streams simultaneously. Activities will include planning and executing the assessment activities, participating in meetings, ensuring the appropriate level of management review on action items and responses, and tracking commitments to closure. Responsibilities: Monitor weekly, monthly, quarterly and bi-annual IT Operational controls Document and demonstrate monitoring activity Provide primary support for yearly SOX IT audit exam for Ratings IT Operations Further institutionalize segregation of duties control across Ratings IT applications Define opportunities for automation of monitoring IT controls Track action plans to completion, monitor and report on IT risk and IT control related activities Manage a portfolio of activities related to planning and executing the IT control assessment activities Strong technical Information security and IT risk management background Outstanding business acumen and communication skills Ability to understand and convey IT control and risk management concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences Provides IT control expertise while working with the businesses and other risk partners Critical thinking and problem solving skills Align to other relevant control assessment activities within the organization Align with findings and management responses resulting from other control assessments with touchpoints Produce regular metrics, reporting, and escalation of items for attention Works in collaboration with other teams to build best practices Conduct reviews of current processes with recommendations on auditing, reporting and exception identification and remediation Reviews IT documentation Required Qualifications Bachelors required or higher degree preferred Strong technology background Experience in the following areas: technology, project management; process management, IT audit and quality control Excellent organizational and team building skills Excellent interpersonal and communications skills with the ability to inspire others to find creative solutions to challenging situations or problems Demonstrates a strong understanding of technology and business including business processes Ability to grasp complex concepts and synthesize towards solutions Problem solver that is resourceful and creative Excellent organizational skills communicate effectively with all levels of management Demonstrated ability to deliver projects that meet the business objectives within scope and schedule Creative, results driven, self-motivated, and solutions oriented to execute projects Demonstrated skills in tailoring presentations/communications to varied audiences (i.e. business vs. technical and working group vs. executive management) Track record of superior performance with emphasis on quality, ability to deliver timely results Ability to operate in a complex, fast paced, matrix environment Willingness to be hands-on and detailed oriented Able to demonstrate leadership, practical approach and ability to influence and negotiate with others. Preferred Qualifications Understanding of basic project management practices; PMP or Six Sigma certification a plus Experience in Technology Audit, and possess an understanding of key Technology general controls and risk mitigation procedures is preferred Experience in Financial Services Understanding of regulatory landscape for Technology Information Systems Auditor (CISA) and Certified Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC) certifications preferred Understanding and knowledge of SharePoint About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of merit, capability and equality of opportunity, and without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law, or any other characteristic that has no bearing on a person’s ability to perform his or her job. JobTitle: S&P Global Platts Commodity Associate Program - January 2018 Start
JobText: Apply Now JobDescription : The Role: S&P Global Platts Commodity Associate Program is seeking candidates that will be involved in gathering and analyzing pricing information for benchmark for various commodities. The Location: Houston TX The Impact: Our real-time news, pricing and analytical services help markets operate with transparency and efficiency. Be part of a global company with a strong history of growth and a globally diverse workforce with 20 offices spanning five continents. Be known as a respected source of essential information and part of a renowned brand. Get the best of both worlds: a nimble, highly specialized company and a business casual culture with the benefits and backing of S&P Global – a company that fosters development and growth, as well as work-life balance. We are looking for world-class thinkers to join our team at S&P Global Platts, the principal provider of commodity price assessment and information to more than 10,000 customers in 150 countries. The content you generate and the relationships you build are essential to the markets. Associates expected to write insightful market commentaries that demonstrate Platts' thought leadership in the market, demonstrating our ability to spot key trends that help customers better anticipate market-moving events and phenomenon. What’s in it for you: 7-month rotational program commencing in January 2018 Commodity Associates receive four weeks of comprehensive training followed by two three month rotations in a different commodity sector – preparing you to move into a permanent price reporting role in one of our commodity teams. Opportunity to learn about various aspects of Oil, Power, Natural Gas, LNG, Coal, Petrochemicals, Metals, Agriculture and Shipping markets Exposure to a number of market subjects including supply and demand, infrastructure issues, geo-political issues, transportation and regulation, and how these subjects impact respective markets Commodity Associates will be trained to work in the price reporting function and will generate price assessments and content (content includes market commentary and news pieces, which power our pricing benchmarks) Commodity Associates will be involved in gathering data and market intelligence and conducting analysis on the assessment and reporting process The Team/The Business: You will be part of a global team in Platts Content. You are considered a specialist in the market(s) you will be working in and being a team player is very important in this role. Responsibilities: Gathers commodity price information and produces price assessments Reports and writes market commentaries and news analysis/features stories Develops and expands coverage of aligned commodities Develops, expands and maintains sources and contacts relevant to the market area of coverage Qualifications: The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree or completed a Master’s degree (preferred) by December 2017 Strong writing skills (preferred) Excellent communication skills (a clear concise writing style is essential together with good verbal skills, listening techniques) Team player with collaborative working style Able to learn quickly, multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment and able to readjust priorities throughout the day to meet deadlines Understand the importance of building strong relationships and partnering with team members Problem-solving and critical thinking skills, attention to detail Intellectually curious; the ability to learn quickly and challenge Strong numeracy skills (including statistics; the ability to conceptualize proportional relationships; and an understanding of economic principles) Proficient with Excel and other Microsoft Office products (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint) To Learn More About Our Program Please Visit– https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2TC14NPPXFSgZpyEaa_SlqeA5Qas4YAc About S&P Global Platts At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.platts.com To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. And we need talent for a key IT initiative to migrate all applications and data to public Cloud. We want to create a pipeline where everything in the Cloud is automated, secure, and immutable. Responsibilities: Enable application migration to public and private Cloud Become subject matter expert in application integration for Cloud, on-prem and hybrid environments Provide integration support of Cloud applications Develop automation to enable Dev, QA and Operations teams to work seamlessly in the Cloud Provide new service offerings through application integration and education Manage and maintain cloud inventory and costs Desired Expertise: Expert level: AWS, configuration management tools (ansible, salt, chef, puppet), common Cloud migration techniques, Cloud native application design patterns, Cloud operations tools and processes such as infrastructure provisioning, application monitoring, governance, and financial optimization Proficient with: common DevOps tools such as Git, Jenkins, and Jira Nice to have: knowledge of Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, IBM SoftLayer, or Rackspace, ServiceNow, ITIL, Docker containers API Experience: Experience working with SOA, Web Services, REST APIs and Messaging Experience with installation, configuration and management of API and Messaging platforms Experience developing highly available services with service definitions, security, and monitoring Experience writing code in Java and SQL Desired Experience: 5 to 10 years of industry experiences, with 2+ years working in public cloud environments Experience working with/for shared service providers with 2+ years creating solutions Experience working in enterprise (large scale, high complexity) IT organizations Experience building cloud-native applications Experience migrating application from traditional datacenters to public cloud Experience migrating applications from dedicated hardware to virtualized stack such as VMware Experience in an operational role – monitoring, system administration, ITSM, service levels, support escalations AWS certifications preferred About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Manager, Financial Analysis The Location: New York, NY – 55 Water Street The Impact: The role is part of the Market Intelligence Global Financial Planning & Analysis team, which is essential in providing monthly reporting and analysis on financial performance across revenue, expense, EBITA and balance sheet. The Business: S&P Global Market Intelligence is a leading provider of financial and industry data, research, news and analytics to investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities worldwide. We combine broad data, powerful analytics and deep sector intelligence to give our clients unrivaled insight into the companies and markets they follow. What’s in it for you: There will be opportunities to be involved in ad-hoc projects with particular emphasis around process improvement and being part of a LEAN, efficient team focused on employing best practices. Responsibilities: Complete monthly consolidated Market Intelligence reporting for review by Senior Finance and Business Leadership Partner with Global MI Finance team to complete variance explanations on actual and historical results compared to budget and prior year for onward reporting to S&P Global Corporate Accounting group and Finance leadership to include both P&L and Balance Sheet variance Respond to both internal and external audit queries and ensuring full compliance internal controls (SOX) providing evidence as required. Assist with the preparation of presentations including Quarterly Financial Review, Quarterly Business Review and Board of Director meetings What We’re Looking For: Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting/Finance or part/fully qualified accountant with 4+years’ proven accounting and financial analysis experience of working in a Global Finance organization operating within a matrix business structure Strong skills in MS Excel (pivot tables, V-lookups) and PowerPoint (ThinkCell an advantage). Quality – is attentive to detail and accuracy, is committed to excellence, looks for improvements continuously, monitors quality levels, finds root cause of quality problems, owns/act acts on quality problems Dependability – meets commitments, works independently, accepts accountability, handles changes, sets personal standards, stays focused under pressure and meets attendance/punctuality requirements. Productivity – manages a fair workload, volunteers for additional work, prioritizes tasks, develops good work procedures, manages time well and handles information flow. Create Superior Customer Value – cultivate long-term, strategic customer relationships by ensuring that the customer’s perspective is the driving force behind business activities, anticipate customer needs and understand criteria to determine whether success was achieved, accept responsibility for outcomes. Communicates Effectively – speak openly and clearly without hidden agendas, adapt your approach and your message to fit the audience. Seek input from others and use sound rationale to gain acceptance of ideas, listen actively and respond in a manner that promotes collaboration, persistently deliver important information and check for understanding to ensure your message is understood. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with ERP (Oracle Financials) and Cognos TM1 is essential. About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit, S&P Global Market Intelligence To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Apply Now JobDescription : Position Description The Role: Marketing Manager The Location: New York City The Team: S&P Global Ratings is a leading provider of credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping to educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. Our team is responsible driving relevance, advocacy and ultimately revenue. The Impact: How do you differentiate a credit rating agency? That is the question you will answer in an industry that has thrived for over 150 years. The work you do will be intrinsic to our success, it’s the essential marketing expertise that understands how the market participant interacts with Ratings and delivers value to them throughout their workflow to drive relevance, advocacy and growth What’s in it for you: Establish and define digital marketing in S&P Global Ratings Build your career as a best in class practioner, with all successes attributable Learn from peers across our brand leading S&P Global divisions Have the ability execute and to say “that was my success” Responsibilities: Design, orchestrate and execute programs including lead generation, nurture, targeted marketing outreach, account based marketing and awareness building activities, designed around the buyer’s journey and customer lifecycle. ensure program plans meet business objectives, and are designed for maximum impact leveraging the customer and buyer’s journey to drive the desired results. Understand the buyer’s journey and customer life cycle and demand waterfall. Must be data driven, analytical and ability to monitor and track success of programs and maintain a campaign dashboard of results and ROI of campaign. Work across the business to drive alignment of the marketing programs to company goals Work with Product Marketing to understanding client needs and value propositions and convert these into marketing programs which will acquire retain and grow our client base as well as driving advocacy in the markets Work with corporate marketing to support all corporate marketing initiatives around brand and messaging. Candidate is required to be pro-active, have the ability work in fast-paced environment, resolve issues and manage multiple stakeholders. What We’re Looking For:Basic Qualifications: Minimum 4-5 years’ experience implementing and managing client-facing Marketing and demand generation programs Self-motivated, demonstrated Project Management skills Ability to work under pressure Experience in working with, as well as influencing and negotiating with various stakeholder groups Strong, clear communications skills as well as the confidence to speak up to lead a discussion Pro-activeness is required and ability to plan ahead Solid organization skills and strong attention to detail is key Good interpersonal and negotiation skills are required with track record of driving measurable and meaningful business results Demonstrated excellent written communications skills, including ability to independently write or edit customer-facing or external communications. About S&P Global Ratings S&P Global Ratings is the world’s leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide. S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes. S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions on the basis of merit, capability and equality of opportunity, and without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law, or any other characteristic that has no bearing on a person’s ability to perform his or her job. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. JobTitle: Cashier & Hardlines Support Associate – Sears Holdings Corporation – 856886BR
JobText: Job Cart (0) Cashier & Hardlines Support Associate Job ID: 856886BR Brand: Sears Employment Status: Regular, Part-time Buying/Merchandising 600 RICHLAND MALL,FLS- MANSFIELD OH,MANSFIELD, OH 44906, US June 18, 2017 Apply Keep Me In Mind Add to Cart The Hardlines Support Associate is responsible for enhancing the experience of our Members and driving sales through courteous and proactive support to Members, accurately and efficiently sales and service transactions, maintaining merchandise standards, ensuring the sales floor is ready all day, and maintaining price integrity. Job Duties/Responsibilities:* Provides the highest degree of Member service by making the Member the first priority; this includes stopping other merchandising tasks in order to assist members. Greets every Member who enters the zone to begin the Member First Engagement process of greet, discover, solve, and close. Demonstrates the right behaviors in the selling process and takes ownership for identifying needs and recommending appropriate solutions. Engages with Members in a professional manner to deliver a Members First experience.* Maintains thorough knowledge of available merchandise, and services to assist Members in locating and selecting merchandise.* Strives to deliver a ‘WOW’ member experience every time, and seeks feedback to ensure they are delivering the right experience, and understand how to improve.* Takes ownership for enhancing the Member experience, and assists with Member concerns Uses the right resources in resolving concerns and complaints, and escalates concerns as needed. Partners with associates storewide to provide superior Member experience (i.e., assist members, maintain presentation, answer phones). Provide an effective transition for the member to another associate as needed to resolve concerns.* Completes Member transactions accurately and efficiently using POS and online systems, including sales, returns and exchanges in accordance with authorized processes. Executes consistent operational and selling processes (e.g., credit application process, care plan) and stays up-to-date on changes.* Versed in the benefits of Shop Your Way (SYW), the elements of a WOW experience, and able to sell the program to members.* Leverages integrated retail technology and Know Your Member in order to facilitate the Member experience.* Educates Members on our Satisfaction Guaranteed return policy. Optimizes credit, gift card, SYW Rewards, and multi-channel opportunities (and, where applicable, Care Plans, Merchandise Replacement Agreements, and other miscellaneous income opportunities).* Sets non-promotional, promotional, and seasonal signing, including store-wide and event signing if assigned to perform this activity. Performs promotional ad setup and take down without error or omissions.* Sets and maintains sales floor to national merchandising and presentation standards.* Performs merchandise support tasks (e.g., straightening merchandise) during each work shift. Responsible for keeping the department ready all day and ensuring the sales floor is easy to shop, in stock, clean, signed and organized for customers.* Performs accurate count updates and inventory adjustments.* Adheres to merchandise protection standards.* Uses basic internet navigation to access and print information/reports.* Stays current and understands the implications of upcoming events, product updates, selling process requirements, and Company/business initiatives.* Maintains on-going knowledge of applicable National Presentation Standards, store merchandise, integrated retail, SYW, and operational processes. Achieves and maintains appropriate levels of learning standards through Segno and other learning systems.* Performs other duties as assigned.Job Requirements:* Basic reading, arithmetic, writing and oral communication skills* Basic Internet navigationEducation Experience: Less Than HS GraduateYears of Related Experience: NoneAge Requirement: 18 years of age or older when multi-level unit with freight elevator Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Vet. JobTitle: Service Desk Associate – Sears Holdings Corporation – 856888BR
JobText: Job Cart (0) Service Desk Associate Job ID: 856888BR Brand: Kmart Employment Status: Regular, Part-time Customer Service 720 CLAIRTON BLVD,ROUTE 51 PLAZA,PLEASANT HILLS, PA 15236, US June 18, 2017 Apply Keep Me In Mind Add to Cart Provides “World Class” Member Service by surprising and delighting our members every day. Performs daily responsibilities including, but not limited to: assisting customers, register operations, answering the phone, making P.A. announcements and completing business service transactions. * Ensures customer care and selling are #1 priority * Maintains a clean work area and replenishes required supplies * Monitors security alarms on front doors and logs all incidents in the Electronic Article Surveillance (EAS) logbook * Knows what reference materials are available and where to access them (Operations binder, ad copy binder, vendor/visitor binder, Electronic Article Surveillance (EAS) logbook, crisis and emergency procedures packet) * Displays strong skill sets in use of the Remote Maintenance Unit (RMU) * Follows corporate guidelines relating to Merchandise Claims & Control (MCC), Known-Loss Merchandise, and Open/Empty Packages * Understands and adheres to American with Disabilities Act (ADA) guidelines when assisting customers with special needs and follows up with the Front End Lead Associate to ensure wheelchairs are available and operational at all times * Offers great, friendly, and efficient customer service by responding quickly to customer calls, making eye contact, smiles and greet customers, answers customers questions and concerns * Answers telephone professionally; monitors incoming calls to ensure timely associate response. Understands and uses proper intercom (P.A.) etiquette * Processes returns on a continual basis and call associates as needed to return stray merchandise to its designated location on the sales floor * Understands the processing of Western Union transactions and money orders. Adheres to all policies and laws governing wire transfers * Understands how to use the on hand inquiry option in the register, and comply with register prompts * Communicates with the manager on duty regarding the completion of the Ad Verification form * Understands precise register functions including, but not limited to: processing all transactions, forms of tender, tax exemptions, rain checks, refunds, exchanges, and paying off credit card and layaway payments. Assist in training checkout service and service desk associates * Uses the Pathfinder in processing returned goods without UPC labels and defective returns * Follows all policies and procedures for efficient refund and exchange transactions, while protecting company assets and unit integrity * Monitors the sale circular and be aware of items that have sold out, substituted items, and/or if rain checks are being issued * Performs other duties as assigned * Good reading, writing, oral and arithmetic skills * Ability to lift and move merchandise, typically a minimum of 20lbs, but could be up to 100lbs * Ability to bend, lift, stretch and reach repetatively * Knowledge of store, services and locations of merchandise * Must be 18 years of age or older EEO EMPLOYER Share this job Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on Linkedin Share by Mail

Company Overview Grainger is a global leading broad line supplier of facilities maintenance products serving businesses and institutions. Our 18,000 employees are driven to serve customers and the community in exceptional ways focusing on delivering the highest level of service. The Grainger team works closely with customers to better understand their challenges and provide cost-saving solutions. Grainger's employees serve customers more than 115,000 times every day through multiple channels. As part of a high-performing team, you’ll be able to develop your talents, and make a difference. Grainger is a Fortune 500company and a perennial member of Fortune magazine's Most Admired Companies list. Position Description The Field Account Representative (FAR) is an outside sales role.  This person is responsible for penetrating all assigned accounts to develop relationships to achieve profitable revenue growth within his/her assigned geography. The FAR partners with established sales and service teams to grow sales among approximately 130 large-sized contract and non-contractually obligated customers.  The assigned customers are in manufacturing and office environments. The compensation is tied to the ability to achieve or exceed established sales targets and other account management tasks. The FAR will make 8-10 quality, revenue generating calls per day. The FAR is required to make decisions influencing sales for large sized customers with and without contractual relationships in his/her assigned account package.  Specific responsibilities include • Determine, prepare and present the appropriate “Grainger Value Proposition” to each account and review how Grainger can add value and help with each account’s purchasing needs • Create a territory plan that optimizes call routes, maximizes time in the field and ensures you are delivering and executing a sales plan that meets or exceeds stated performance targets • Consistently maintain account and customer contact and record follow up details in Grainger’s CRM. • Consistently take a proactive approach to driving sales with each account while utilizing a wide array of available communication channels in order maximize their purchasing with Grainger through all of Grainger’s sales / service channels. • Establish and/or extend current relationships with customers in a productive and mutually beneficial manner • Timely and responsive to customers’ real-time needs     Position Requirements: All candidates must have • 1-3 years of previous sales and/or relationship building experience • Excellent presentation, verbal and written communication skills • Exhibits high integrity in all business dealings • Strong time management and organizational skills • High School Diploma or GED, two or four year degree preferred • Must have a valid driver’s license • Ability to travel and have occasional overnights as needed All candidates must demonstrate ability to • Ability to grow revenue to stated thresholds. • Rapidly build knowledge of Grainger’s product lines • Required to drive a Grainger branded vehicle within assigned sales territory • Ability to achieve or exceed stated metrics of daily calls, customer face time minutes, etc. • Regularly exercise independent judgment and discretion when interacting with all accounts and determining product and service offerings • Effectively use quantitative skills to report accurate information on overall results of customer interactions. • Ability to work in a highly matrixed organization • Understands buying decisions, buying processes and cash flow dynamics of aligned customers. • Understand and use basic selling techniques: open, probe, presentation, over-coming objections • Ability to identify opportunities, negotiate and manage sales; manage business needs and cost requirements. • Understand, apply and synthesize data/information regarding customers and account package • Work locations will be dependent upon conditions of the aligned customer locations. (including manufacturing, healthcare and office environments) • You could be required to wear personal protective equipment (i.e. protective footwear, safety eyewear, etc.) • Reports to Manager • Compensation will be driven by the ability to achieve or exceed established sales targets and other account management tasks. Directly impacts the short and long-term financial results of approximately 130 assigned accounts and approximately $1.5M annually by • Driving sales and profits at customers • Providing the highest quality of service to Grainger customers Success will come through the development of mutually beneficial relationships that helps our customers and drives our revenue growth.   EEOC Statement Grainger is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

TITLE:  SENIOR DIRECTOR, REGIONAL DISTRIBUTION CENTER W.W. Grainger, Inc. (NYSE: GWW), headquartered in Lake Forest, Illinois, is an industrial supply company founded in 1927.  With 23,000 employees, Grainger partners closely with customers to understand their challenges and provide cost-effective solutions for their maintenance, repair and operations (MRO) needs.  The organization is a Fortune 500 Company with greater than $10B in revenue, and a perennial member of Fortune magazine’s Most Admired Companies List.    BASIC FUNCTION:  Based in Minooka, IL, the Sr. Director, Regional Distribution will lead a large, complex distribution center and provide leadership for 2 or more remote distribution sites. This executive also will be responsible for ensuring the entire region attains all goals in people, service, cost and team member engagement metrics by implementing best practices and identifying new and emerging technologies that will improve operations. This individual will ensure the Grainger distribution network remains the industry leader in service, productivity, safety and quality by anticipating needs of customers and the organization. The Sr. Director, Regional Distribution will report directly to the Vice President Distribution Operations  and further serve as a member of the senior DC leadership team that works to optimize the distribution network to achieve the company’s objectives and overall business plan.    KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Lead and develop their site and region’s team members by creating and sharing a common vision and understanding of the organization’s strategy. Deliver results that achieve the company strategy and expectations; ensure operational excellence across the Distribution Network. Accountable for $200M+ in inventory in a through-put distribution network serving 1.4M+ customers. Ensure that the proper goals and objectives are set and achieved (People, Service, Cost and Team Engagement) Ensure the smooth flow of product from supplier to Branch and supplier to customer. Ensure standardization and sharing of best-demonstrated practices across distribution center network. Drive Operational Excellence (OE) and continuous improvement to enable operational excellence.  Support aligned Regional Continuous Management leader in implementation of a viable and impactful CI program. Anticipate the needs of customers and the organization and ensure that the proper tools are developed or acquired to support the fulfillment of those needs. Ensure distribution centers practices, procedures and facilities are in compliance with all applicable state and federal regulations and Grainger’s policies.   REQUIRED EXPERIENCES AND COMPETENCIES:   Bachelor’s degree; MBA preferred Minimum 7 to 10 years high level management experience in a high volume, multi-shift, distribution/order fulfillment operation with large employee populations. Demonstrated understanding of distribution, transportation, and inventory management principles and practices with strong customer focus Minimum 7 years of demonstrated ability to develop and maintain positive employee relations, effective relationships within and across functional boundaries and with suppliers Ability to promote and lead change Capable of exploring beyond traditional business practices and altering them in a positive, productive manner Strong process improvement, problem-solving, analytical and financial management skills Strong communication skills. Ability to lead a large organization through communication of the Company’s vision and strategic direction and translating to results oriented actions Ability to deliver clear messages to all levels of the organization   Grainger is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or protected veteran status.

Company Overview Grainger is a broad line, business-to-business distributor of maintenance, repair and operating (MRO) supplies and other related products and services. More than 3.2 million businesses and institutions worldwide rely on Grainger for products such as safety gloves, ladders, motors and janitorial supplies, along with services like inventory management and technical support. These customers represent a broad collection of industries including commercial, government, healthcare and manufacturing. They place orders online, on mobile devices, through sales representatives, over the phone and at local branches. Approximately 5,000 suppliers provide Grainger with more than 1.6 million products stocked in Grainger’s distribution centers and branches worldwide.   Position Description The Transportation Analyst is responsible for statistical analysis, forecasting extrapolation,. Connecting analytics insights to decisions and actions. Identifying optimization and demonstrated transportation best practices across the network. Responsible for standard and consistent analysis & metrics.   Principle Duties/Responsibilities – Analyst Develop, analyze, and recommend opportunities for improvement that optimize transportation policies and processes around availability, transportation cost, and supply chain cost. Identification, selection, negotiation and recommendation of cost/service effective alternative solutions. Manage project to expectations and to delivery goals Support continuous improvement and LEAN initiatives Work closely with cross functional partners to ensure proper alignment in communicating with carriers and other internal partners (DC, Purchasing, etc.) Analysis and audit Analysis utilizing transportation, freight payment and carrier databases to determine underlying causes of freight cost trends, identify inefficiencies, noncompliance and other opportunities for improvement Work with Transportation Analysts and other internal partners to identify process improvement opportunities and to implement new policies and processes Conduct audits to gaps in processes Maintain and measure previously implemented projects/processes Develop and utilize cross functional relationships Serve as a key contact for cross functional projects Working through challenging issues in a constructive manner Strategy Extrapolate data into written reports/presentations Contextualize analytics into business perspective Support strategy/vision for future network and all known changes Position Requirements: BS/BA Preferred 1-2 Years of experience in field preferred Intermediate software skills such as Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and SAP highly preferred. Demonstrated skills and experience in: Basic understanding of the supply chain tradeoffs between functions Analyzing data, developing a recommended course of action and implementing a successful solution Working through challenging issues in a constructive manner Excellent written, verbal, and electronic communication skills. Ability to communicate confidently and effectively in various ways up to VP level of management (e.g. written, oral, and presentation) Has proven relationship building skills and handles conflict gracefully EEOC Statement Grainger is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

JobTitle: Field Account Representative - Huntington Beach, Buena Park, Santa Fe Springs, CA
JobText: Company Overview Grainger is a global leading broad line supplier of facilities maintenance products serving businesses and institutions. Our 18,000 employees are driven to serve customers and the community in exceptional ways focusing on delivering the highest level of service. The Grainger team works closely with customers to better understand their challenges and provide cost-saving solutions. Grainger's employees serve customers more than 115,000 times every day through multiple channels. As part of a high-performing team, you’ll be able to develop your talents, and make a difference. Grainger is a Fortune 500company and a perennial member of Fortune magazine's Most Admired Companies list. Position Description The Field Account Representative (FAR) is an outside sales role.  This person is responsible for penetrating all assigned accounts to develop relationships to achieve profitable revenue growth within his/her assigned geography. The FAR partners with established sales and service teams to grow sales among approximately 130 large-sized contract and non-contractually obligated customers.  The assigned customers are in manufacturing and office environments. The compensation is tied to the ability to achieve or exceed established sales targets and other account management tasks. The FAR will make 8-10 quality, revenue generating calls per day.
